original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / skye ba dang ni rga shi dag / lhan cig rung ba ma yin no //
translated: Here we say:🔽It is not tenable that birth and aging and death🔽Occur simultaneously.

original: skye bzhin par ni 'chi 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: skye bzhin par ni 'chi 'gyur zhing //
translated: If they occurred simultaneously,

original: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
analyzed: gnyi ga rgyu med can du 'gyur //
translated: Both would be causeless.

original: skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dag lhan cig nyid du 'gyur bar mi 'thad de /
translated: It is not tenable that birth and aging and death occur simultaneously.

original: ji ste lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni //
analyzed: ji ste lhan cig nyid du 'gyur na ni //
translated: If they occurred simultaneously,

original: skye bzhin pa na 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang // gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa na 'chi bar 'gyur ba dang // gnyi ga rgyu med pa can du 'gyur bas de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: then birth would be death, and both would be causeless. But that is untenable.

original: @56a * // 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: @56a * // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa de dag mi 'thad kyang yang skye ba dang rga shi dag yod pas de dag gang gi yin pa'i bdag kyang yod do //
analyzed: de dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa de dag mi 'thad kyang yang skye ba dang rga shi dag yod pas de dag gang gi yin pa'i bdag kyang yod do //
translated: Although the sequence of earlier, later, and simultaneous is untenable for them, since birth and aging and death exist, the self that possesses them also exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang la snga phyi lhan cig gi / rim pa de dag mi srid pa'i //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:🔽For that birth and those aging and deaths🔽In which the sequence of earlier, later, and simultaneous

original: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
analyzed: skye ba de dang rga shi de //
translated: Is impossible,

original: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
analyzed: ci yi phyir na spros par byed //
translated: Why do you fabricate them?

original: de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste brtags na /
analyzed: de ltar rigs pa sngon du btang ste brtags na /
translated: When you examine this with reasoning,

original: skye ba dang rga shi dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa de dag mi srid na /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dag la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa de dag mi srid na /
translated: If the sequence of birth and aging and death as earlier, later, or simultaneous is not possible,

original: de la ci'i skye ba de rga shi de zhes spros par byed cing rjod par byed /
analyzed: de la ci'i skye ba de rga shi de zhes spros par byed cing rjod par byed /
translated: then why do you fabricate and say, “This is birth” and “This is aging and death”?

original: de dag mi 'thad na /
analyzed: de dag mi 'thad na /
translated: If those are not tenable,

original: bdag yod par 'thad par ga la 'gyur //🔽rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
analyzed: bdag yod par 'thad par ga la 'gyur // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang ni //
translated: how could the self be tenable?🔽Cause and effect,

original: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
analyzed: mtshan nyid dang ni mtshan gzhi nyid //
translated: characteristics and the basis of those characteristics,

original: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni //
analyzed: tshor dang tshor po nyid dang ni //
translated: feeling and the feeler,

original: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
analyzed: don yod gang dag ci yang rung //
translated: and any other objects

original: ji ltar brtags na /
analyzed: ji ltar brtags na /
translated: If you analyze in what way,

original: skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi dag gi snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as the sequence of birth and aging and death as earlier, later, or simultaneous is not tenable,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid dang / tshor ba dang tshor ba po nyid dang / don gzhan gang dag ci yang rung ba rnam par grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / shes pa dang shes bya dang /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid dang / mtshan nyid dang mtshan nyid kyi gzhi nyid dang / tshor ba dang tshor ba po nyid dang / don gzhan gang dag ci yang rung ba rnam par grol ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / shes pa dang shes bya dang /
translated: so cause and effect, characteristics and the basis of those characteristics, feeling and the feeler, and any other objects such as liberation, nirvana, consciousness, and objects of consciousness,

original: tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa de dag yod par brtag pa de dag thams cad la yang snga phyi dang lhan cig gi go  rim pa dag mi 'thad do //🔽'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
analyzed: tshad ma dang gzhal bya la sogs pa de dag yod par brtag pa de dag thams cad la yang snga phyi dang lhan cig gi go  rim pa dag mi 'thad do // 'khor ba 'ba' zhig sngon gyi mtha' //
translated: In all of these analyses of the existence of valid cognitions and objects of valid cognition, the sequence of prior and subsequent and simultaneity are untenable.

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: The cyclic existence alone does not have a prior limit.

original: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
analyzed: dngos rnams thams cad nyid la yang //
translated: It is not the case that all things do not have a prior limit.

original: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin //🔽gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi dngos
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' ni yod ma yin // gang gi phyir de ltar yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du brtags na dngos po thams cad la snga phyi dang lhan cig gi rim pa dag mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'khor ba 'ba' zhig la sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi dngos
translated: The prior limit of all things does not exist.

original: por 'dod pa thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: por 'dod pa thams cad la yang sngon gyi mtha' yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Since, when properly analyzed in this way, the sequence of prior and subsequent and simultaneity are untenable for all things, therefore not only does cyclic existence alone not have a prior limit, but also the prior limit of all things that are asserted to be things does not exist.

original: dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang dri za'i grong khyer dang gzugs brnyan bzhin du 'grub bo //
analyzed: dngos por snang ba ni sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang dri za'i grong khyer dang gzugs brnyan bzhin du 'grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the appearance of things is established as like a magician’s illusion, a mirage, a city of gandharvas, and a reflection.

original: 'khor ba brtags pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba brtags pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the chapter that examines cyclic existence.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gcig pa'o /
translated: It is the eleventh chapter.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod pas de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal yod do //
analyzed: kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas pa dang / gzhan gyis byas pa dang gnyi gas byas pa dang / rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod pas de'i phyir de ltar sdug bsngal yod do //
translated: “Since some assert that suffering is self-produced, produced by another, produced by both, or arises without a cause, therefore suffering exists.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: @56b kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas //
analyzed: @56b kha cig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas //
translated: Some assert that suffering is self-produced,

original: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas dang gnyi gas byas //
translated: Produced by another, produced by both,

original: rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod //
translated: Or arises without a cause.

original: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo //🔽'di la kha cig gis ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par 'dod /
analyzed: de ni bya bar mi rung ngo // 'di la kha cig gis ni sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par 'dod /
translated: That is untenable.🔽Here some assert that suffering is self-produced.

original: kha cig ni gzhan gyis byas par 'dod /
analyzed: kha cig ni gzhan gyis byas par 'dod /
translated: Some assert that suffering is produced by another.

original: kha cig ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas par 'dod /
analyzed: kha cig ni bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas byas par 'dod /
translated: Some assert that suffering is produced by both self and another.

original: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod de /
analyzed: kha cig ni rgyu med pa las byung bar 'dod de /
translated: Some assert that suffering arises without a cause.

original: de ni rim pa bzhi po de dag gang gis kyang bya ba yin pa mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de ni rim pa bzhi po de dag gang gis kyang bya ba yin pa mi rung ngo //
translated: That is untenable, since it cannot be produced in any of these four ways.

original: de la 'di snyam du rigs pa gang gis bya bar mi rung snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rigs pa gang gis bya bar mi rung snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think, “By what reasoning is it not tenable that suffering is self-created?”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te bdag gis byas gyur na //
translated: If suffering were self-created,

original: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de phyir brten nas 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: Then it would not arise in dependence.

original: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
analyzed: gang phyir phung po 'di dag la //
translated: Because these aggregates

original: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
analyzed: brten nas phung po de dag 'byung //
translated: Those aggregates arise in dependence on them.

original: gal te sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par gyur na /
translated: If suffering were self-created,

original: da lta na brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: da lta na brten nas 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then it would not arise in dependence.

original: brten nas kyang 'byung ste /🔽gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: brten nas kyang 'byung ste / gang gi phyir da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag la brten nas ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir /
translated: But it does arise in dependence.

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rigs so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis byas par mi rigs so //
translated: Because those future aggregates arise in dependence on these present aggregates, therefore it is not tenable that suffering is self-created.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas kyang gzhan gyis byas te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag gis ma byas kyang gzhan gyis byas te /
translated: “Although suffering is not self-created, it is created by another.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: gang gi phyir phung po gzhan du 'gyur ba 'di dag la brten nas phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir phung po gzhan du 'gyur ba 'di dag la brten nas phung po de dag 'byung ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because those aggregates arise in dependence on these aggregates that are transformed into another.”

original: /'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
analyzed: /'dir bshad pa / gal te de las 'di gzhan zhing //
translated: Here it is said:🔽If this is different from that,

original: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
analyzed: gal te 'di las de gzhan na //
translated: and if that is different from this,

original: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
analyzed: gzhan de dag gis 'di byas pas //
translated: then since that other would create this,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur //🔽gal te ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag las da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par 'gyur // gal te ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag las da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag gzhan yin par gyur cing /
translated: suffering would be created by another.🔽If these present aggregates were different from those future aggregates,

original: da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag las kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: da ltar gyi phung po 'di dag las kyang ma 'ongs pa'i phung po de dag gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
translated: and if those future aggregates were different from these present aggregates,

original: de lta na da ltar gyi phung po gzhan de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i phung po gzhan 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na da ltar gyi phung po gzhan de dag gis ma 'ongs pa'i phung po gzhan 'di dag byas pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then since that other—the present aggregates—would create this other—the future aggregates—suffering would be created by another.

original: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But because that is not so, therefore it is not tenable that suffering is created by another.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyis sdug bsngal byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'o //
translated: Therefore, we do not say that suffering is self-produced.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu dang rkyen las byung bas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang mi smra'o //
translated: Since suffering arises from causes and conditions, therefore we do not say that suffering is produced by another.

original: sdug bsngal @57a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal @57a * //
translated: Suffering is produced by the self.

original: gang zag bdag gis byas pas de'i phyir re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra la /
analyzed: gang zag bdag gis byas pas de'i phyir re zhig sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra la /
translated: Therefore, we say that suffering is self-produced.🔽Suffering is produced by another person.

original: sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
translated: Therefore, we say that suffering is produced by another.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te gang zag bdag gis ni //
translated: Here we say:🔽If suffering is produced by the self,

original: sdug bsngal byas na gang bdag gis //🔽sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
analyzed: sdug bsngal byas na gang bdag gis // sdug bsngal byas pa'i gang zag ni //
translated: then what is the person🔽who produces suffering?

original: sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin //
analyzed: sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin //
translated: What is the person who is without suffering?

original: gal te gang zag bdag gis phung po sdug bsngal byas par sems na /
analyzed: gal te gang zag bdag gis phung po sdug bsngal byas par sems na /
translated: If you think that the self produces the suffering of the aggregates,

original: gang gi sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag des sdug bsngal de ma byas pa'i snga rol na byed pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin te de 'di'o zhes bstan dgos nas /
analyzed: gang gi sdug bsngal de byas pa'i gang zag des sdug bsngal de ma byas pa'i snga rol na byed pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin te de 'di'o zhes bstan dgos nas /
translated: The person who creates that suffering must be shown to be the person who, prior to the creation of that suffering, is without suffering.

original: de yang med pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yang med pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de mi 'thad do //
translated: But since that person does not exist, therefore it is untenable to say, “The person creates suffering.”

original: gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas so zhes gang smras pa de la yang bshad par bya ste /🔽gal te gang zag gzhan las ni //
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyis sdug bsngal byas so zhes gang smras pa de la yang bshad par bya ste / gal te gang zag gzhan las ni //
translated: Now, suppose one said that suffering is created by another person.

original: sdug bsngal 'byung na gzhan zhig gis //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'byung na gzhan zhig gis //
translated: If suffering arose from another,

original: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
analyzed: sdug bsngal de byas gang sbyin de //
translated: then the one who gave the suffering

original: sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung //🔽gal te gang zag gzhan gyis phung po sdug bsngal byas shing des de byas nas gzhan la sbyin par byed na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal med par ji ltar rung // gal te gang zag gzhan gyis phung po sdug bsngal byas shing des de byas nas gzhan la sbyin par byed na /
translated: would not have suffering.🔽If the suffering of the other person’s aggregates were created by another person, and having been created by that person, it were given to the other person,

original: sbyin pa byed pa des de byas nas gang la sbyin par bya ba de la ma sbyin pa'i snga rol na /
analyzed: sbyin pa byed pa des de byas nas gang la sbyin par bya ba de la ma sbyin pa'i snga rol na /
translated: then the one who gives the suffering, having created it, would not give it to the one to whom it is given.

original: len par byed pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin te /
analyzed: len par byed pa'i gang zag sdug bsngal med pa de gang yin te /
translated: What is that person who appropriates and is without suffering?

original: de 'di'o zhes bstan dgos na /
analyzed: de 'di'o zhes bstan dgos na /
translated: It must be shown that “this is it.”

original: de yang med pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de yang med pas de'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But since that does not exist, therefore it is also untenable to state, “Suffering is produced by another person.”

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: bdag gis byas par ma grub pas //🔽sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
analyzed: bdag gis byas par ma grub pas // sdug bsngal gzhan gyis ga la byas //
translated: Since self-production is not established,🔽how could suffering be produced by another?

original: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
analyzed: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa //
translated: If suffering were produced by another,

original: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni de yi bdag byas 'gyur //
translated: that other would be the self-producer.

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal byas par rab tu ma grub pas /
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal byas par rab tu ma grub pas /
translated: Since self-production of suffering is not established,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: how could suffering be produced by another?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa de ni de'i bdag gis byas pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan gyis sdug bsngal gang byed pa de ni de'i bdag gis byas pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If suffering were produced by another, that other would be the self-producer.

original: de yang dang po nyid du rigs pas yongs su brtags na sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas par mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: de yang dang po nyid du rigs pas yongs su brtags na sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas par mi 'thad pas /
translated: But first, when this is thoroughly investigated with reasoning, it is untenable that suffering is produced by the person himself.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas par ma grub pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang @57b mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal gang zag bdag gis byas par ma grub pas sdug bsngal gzhan gyis byas par yang @57b mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, since suffering is not established as self-produced, it is also untenable that suffering is produced by another.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽sdug bsngal de las gang zag de gzhan gyi ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal byas pa'i phyir rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra zhing sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pas rnam grangs las sdug bsngal gzhan
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / sdug bsngal de las gang zag de gzhan gyi ma yin pas sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal byas pa'i phyir rnam grangs las sdug bsngal bdag gis byas so zhes kyang smra zhing sdug bsngal gang yin pa de nyid gang zag ma yin pas rnam grangs las sdug bsngal gzhan
translated: Objection:

original: gyis byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
analyzed: gyis byas so zhes kyang smra'o //
translated: Since that person is not different from that suffering, suffering is produced by suffering. Therefore, from one point of view, we say that suffering is self-produced. Since that person is not that suffering, from another point of view, we say that suffering is produced by another.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal bdag byas min //
translated: Suffering is not self-produced.

original: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
analyzed: de nyid kyis ni de ma byas //
translated: It is not produced by itself.

original: re zhig sdug bsngal rnam grangs las bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de mi 'thad de /
analyzed: re zhig sdug bsngal rnam grangs las bdag gis byas so zhes bya ba de mi 'thad de /
translated: Suffering is not self-produced. From one point of view, it is untenable to say that suffering is self-produced.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de nyid kyis de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyis de ma byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not produced by itself.

original: sdug bsngal rnam grangs las gzhan gyis byas so zhes gang smras pa de la yang dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam grangs las gzhan gyis byas so zhes gang smras pa de la yang dpyad par bya ste /
translated: But this should be investigated:

original: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
analyzed: gal te gzhan bdag ma byas na //
translated: If another is not self-produced,

original: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur //🔽gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa de yang gal te gzhan te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gzhan byas ga la 'gyur // gzhan gyis byas so zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa de yang gal te gzhan te /
translated: how could suffering be produced by another?

original: bdag nyid ma byas shing ma grub na sdug bsngal de gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag nyid ma byas shing ma grub na sdug bsngal de gzhan gyis byas par ga la 'gyur /
translated: If you think that suffering is produced by another, then that which is called “another” is not self-produced and is not established. How could that suffering be produced by another?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga 'dus pas byas pa yod do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi ga 'dus pas byas pa yod do //
translated: Suffering is produced by both self and another.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gal te re res byas gyur na //
analyzed: gal te re res byas gyur na //
translated: If it is produced by each,

original: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur //
translated: suffering would be produced by both.

original: gal te re res byas pa yod par 'gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te re res byas pa yod par 'gyur na ni /
translated: If it is produced by each,

original: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gnyi gas byas par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: suffering would be produced by both.🔽If it is produced by each, then suffering would be produced by both.

original: gang gi phyir de la ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas 'dus pas byas pa yang med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de la ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal bdag dang gzhan gnyi gas 'dus pas byas pa yang med do //
translated: But that is not the case. Therefore, suffering is not produced by both self and another.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone objects:

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi gas byas par mi rigs na /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi gas byas par mi rigs na /
translated: Thus, it is illogical that suffering is created by self, by other, or by both.

original: 'o na sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'o na sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung ba yin no //
translated: Well then, does suffering arise causelessly?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma byas bdag ma byas //
translated: It is not created by another, nor by itself.

original: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu med ga la 'gyur //
translated: How could suffering arise causelessly?

original: de ltar gzhan gyis kyang ma byas bdag gis kyang ma byas na /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan gyis kyang ma byas bdag gis kyang ma byas na /
translated: Thus, if it is not created by another, nor by itself,

original: sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'thad de /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyu med pa las byung bar ga la 'thad de /
translated: how could suffering be tenable as arising causelessly?

original: skyon chen por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: skyon chen por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig rnam pa bzhi //
translated: Because it would absurdly follow that there would be a great error.

original: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
analyzed: yod ma yin pa ma yin gyi //
translated: Suffering is not the only thing that does not exist in these four ways.

original: phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang //
analyzed: phyi rol dngos po rnams la yang //
translated: External things also

original: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin //🔽phung po sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po yod ma yin // phung po sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig la //
translated: do not exist in these four ways.

original: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las byung ba @58a * //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las byung ba @58a * //
translated: The aggregates are not the self, nor do they possess the self,🔽Nor is the self in them, nor do they exist in the self.

original: rnam pa bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po dag yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po de dag yod pa ma yin par ma zad kyi phyi rol gyi dngos po gzugs la sogs pa rnams la yang rnam pa bzhi po dag yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Not only do these four aspects not exist, but also the external things such as form do not have these four aspects.

original: sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the examination of suffering.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the twelfth chapter in the Treatise on the Middle Way.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: rnam pa bzhi po dag med du zin kyang sdug bsngal dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'du byed rnams ni yod do //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi po dag med du zin kyang sdug bsngal dang phyi rol gyi dngos po 'du byed rnams ni yod do //
translated: “Even if the four aspects do not exist, suffering and external things, the compounded phenomena, exist.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / chos gang slu ba de brdzun zhes //
translated: Here, we say:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs //
translated: The Lord Buddha said that any phenomenon that is deceptive is false.

original: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad slu ba'i chos //
translated: All compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin //
translated: Therefore, they are false.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las chos gang slu ba de ni brdzun pa'o //🔽dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde las chos gang slu ba de ni brdzun pa'o // dge slong dag 'di lta ste /
translated: Here, the Lord Buddha said in the sūtras, “Any phenomenon that is deceptive is false.”

original: mi slu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i chos mya ngan las 'das pa de ni bden pa'i mchog go zhes gsungs pas /
translated: Bhikṣhus, thus, the nondeceptive phenomenon, nirvāṇa, is the supreme truth.

original: de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad ni slu ba'i chos yin pas /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'du byed thams cad ni slu ba'i chos yin pas /
translated: Therefore, all compounded phenomena are deceptive phenomena.

original: des na de dag brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: des na de dag brdzun pa yin te /
translated: Thus, they are false,

original: log par snang ba'i phyir rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo stong pa yin no //
analyzed: log par snang ba'i phyir rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo stong pa yin no //
translated: because they appear falsely. They are empty of the nature that is imagined.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: gal te 'du byed slu ba'i chos gang yin pa de brdzun pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'du byed slu ba'i chos gang yin pa de brdzun pa yin na /
translated: If that which is a deceptive phenomenon is false,

original: de gnyi ga yang med pa'i don yin par 'dra bas /
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang med pa'i don yin par 'dra bas /
translated: then since both of those are similar in having the meaning of nonexistence,

original: slu ba'i chos kyis brdzun pa ji ltar bsgrub par bya /
analyzed: slu ba'i chos kyis brdzun pa ji ltar bsgrub par bya /
translated: how could a deceptive phenomenon establish falsity?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, the response is:

original: gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
analyzed: gal te slu chos gang yin pa //
translated: If that which is a deceptive phenomenon

original: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //
analyzed: de brdzun de la ci zhig slu //
translated: is false, what is deceptive about it?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de gsungs pa //
translated: The Transcendent Conqueror taught that

original: stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
analyzed: stong nyid yongs su bstan pa yin //
translated: emptiness is the complete relinquishment of all views.

original: gal te slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de brdzun pa yin na ni med pa'i don yin par 'dra bas de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te slu ba'i chos zhes gsungs pa gang yin pa de brdzun pa yin na ni med pa'i don yin par 'dra bas de la ci zhig slu bar 'gyur /
translated: If that which is called a deceptive phenomenon is false, then since both of those are similar in having the meaning of nonexistence, what is deceptive about it?

original: 'di ltar slu ba ni log par snang ba yin la brdzun pa ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pas med pa'i don ma yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos kyis brdzun pa bsgrub tu rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar slu ba ni log par snang ba yin la brdzun pa ni rnam par brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid stong pa yin pas med pa'i don ma yin pa'i phyir slu ba'i chos kyis brdzun pa bsgrub tu rung ngo //
translated: Thus, deception is an appearance of falsity, and falsity is the emptiness of an essential nature that is imagined. Therefore, since it does not mean nonexistence, it is appropriate to establish falsity by the quality of deception.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis slu ba'i chos zhes bya ba de gsungs pa ni stong pa nyid yongs su ston par byed pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the statement by the Transcendent Lord that “things have the quality of deception” should be understood to reveal emptiness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
analyzed: dngos rnams ngo bo nyid med de //
translated: Things do not exist essentially

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba snang phyir ro //
translated: Because they are seen to change into something else.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni med pa dang chos bdag med pa'i don ma yin gyi dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni med pa dang chos bdag med pa'i don ma yin gyi dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa'i don yin te /
translated: The statement by the Transcendent Lord that “things are false” does not mean that they are nonexistent or that they are devoid of intrinsic nature. It means that persons do not exist essentially in things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur @58b ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur @58b ba snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are seen to change into something else.

original: ngo bo nyid med dngos po med //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med dngos po med //
translated: Things that do not exist essentially do not exist.

original: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos rnams stong pa nyid //
translated: Because things are empty.

original: chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po ni med do //
analyzed: chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa'i dngos po ni med do //
translated: There is no entity that is devoid of the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams stong pa nyid yin na chos kyi ngo bo nyid yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po rnams stong pa nyid yin na chos kyi ngo bo nyid yod par mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if things are empty, the existence of the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon is untenable.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
analyzed: gzhan du 'gyur ba gang gi yin //
translated: whose transformation is it?

original: gal te chos kyi ngo bo nyid med na /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi ngo bo nyid med na /
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality of a phenomenon,

original: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba dag gi yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas skabs gzhan du 'gyur bar snang ba dag gi yin par 'gyur te /
translated: whose transformation is it that appears?

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa'i don yin gyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis brdzun pa zhes gsungs pa ni dngos po rnams la gang zag ngo bo nyid med pa'i don yin gyi chos kyi ngo bo nyid med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the statement by the Blessed One that things are false means that the person is devoid of intrinsic reality, not that the phenomenon is devoid of intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If there is intrinsic reality,

original: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: how could it transform?

original: gal te chos kyi ngo bo nyid yod na de ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te chos kyi ngo bo nyid yod na de ji ltar gzhan du 'gyur te /
translated: If there is the intrinsic reality of a phenomenon, how could it transform?

original: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not transform.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
analyzed: de nyid la ni gzhan 'gyur med //
translated: Transformation does not exist for that which is itself.

original: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la yang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor does it exist for that which is other.

original: gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
analyzed: gang phyir gzhon nu mi rga ste //
translated: Because a youth does not age,

original: gang phyir rgas ba'ang mi rga'o //
analyzed: gang phyir rgas ba'ang mi rga'o //
translated: and because an aged one also does not age.

original: 'di la dngos po khas blangs pa de la gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'di la dngos po khas blangs pa de la gzhan du 'gyur ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Here, in regard to the assertion that things exist, transformation is twofold:

original: de nyid dam gzhan zhig 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de nyid dam gzhan zhig 'gyur grang na /
translated: it is either that which is itself or it is other.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Both are untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gang gi phyir gzhon nu mi rga la gang gi phyir rgas pa yang mi rga ba'i phyir ro //🔽'dir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhon nu mi rga la gang gi phyir rgas pa yang mi rga ba'i phyir ro // 'dir smras pa /
translated: Because a youth does not age and because an aged one also does not age.

original: gal te de nyid gzhan du 'gyur na des skyon cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan du 'gyur na des skyon cir 'gyur /
translated: Objection: If that which is itself transforms, what fault would there be?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te 'di nyid gzhan 'gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'di nyid gzhan 'gyur na //
translated: If this itself transforms,

original: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma nyid ni zhor 'gyur ro //
translated: then milk itself would become yogurt.

original: gal te de nyid gzhan du 'gyur na de lta na 'o ma nyid zhor 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid gzhan du 'gyur na de lta na 'o ma nyid zhor 'gyur te /
translated: If that which is itself transforms, then in that case milk itself would become yogurt.

original: de lta bu ni mi 'thad do ;
analyzed: de lta bu ni mi 'thad do ;
translated: That is untenable.

original: / ci ste 'di snyam du gzhan zhig gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: / ci ste 'di snyam du gzhan zhig gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that one thing transforms into another,

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: 'o ma las gzhan gang gi ni //
analyzed: 'o ma las gzhan gang gi ni //
translated: What thing that is different from milk

original: dngos po zho ni yin par 'gyur //
analyzed: dngos po zho ni yin par 'gyur //
translated: could be called “curds”?

original: gal te gzhan zhig gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: gal te gzhan zhig gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: If you think that one thing transforms into another,

original: 'o ma las gzhan pa gang gi dngos po zho yin par 'gyur /🔽de'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga yang gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'o ma las gzhan pa gang gi dngos po zho yin par 'gyur / de'i phyir rnam pa gnyi ga yang gzhan du 'gyur bar mi 'thad do //
translated: then what thing that is different from milk could be called “curds”?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is untenable that either of the two, milk and curds, transforms.

original: ci 'o na da stong pa zhes bya ba de'i mthar thug pa yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'o na da stong pa zhes bya ba de'i mthar thug pa yin nam /
translated: Objection: Well then, is emptiness the ultimate?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
analyzed: gal te stong min cung zad yod //
translated: If something nonempty existed

original: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa'ang cung zad yod par 'gyur //
translated: then something empty would also exist.

original: mi stong cung zad yod min na //🔽stong pa'ang @59a * //
analyzed: mi stong cung zad yod min na // stong pa'ang @59a * //
translated: But since something nonempty does not exist,

original: yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could something empty exist?

original: gal te mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te mi stong pa cung zad cig yod par gyur na ni /
translated: If something nonempty existed,

original: des na de'i gnyen po stong pa yang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: des na de'i gnyen po stong pa yang cung zad yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then its opposite, something empty, would also exist.

original: mi stong pa cung zad yod pa de ltar khas ma blangs pas de'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir stong pa yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: mi stong pa cung zad yod pa de ltar khas ma blangs pas de'i gnyen po med pa'i phyir stong pa yang yod par ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since we do not assert that even the slightest nonempty thing exists, how could emptiness exist, since its antidote would not exist?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: rgyal ba rnams kyis stong nyid ni //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyis stong nyid ni //
translated: The victors have said that emptiness

original: lta kun nges par 'byin par gsungs //
analyzed: lta kun nges par 'byin par gsungs //
translated: Is the definite release from all views.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid lta ba //
translated: Those who view emptiness

original: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
analyzed: de dag bsgrub tu med par gsungs //
translated: Have been said to be incurable.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis stong pa nyid ni lta ba thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur ba yin pa'i phyir lta ba kun las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs pas /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyis stong pa nyid ni lta ba thams cad kyi gnyen por gyur ba yin pa'i phyir lta ba kun las nges par 'byin pa yin par gsungs pas /
translated: The transcendent conquerors have said that emptiness is the definite release from all views because it is the antidote to all views.

original: gang dag stong pa nyid du lta ba de dag ni bsgrub tu mi rung ba nyid yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: gang dag stong pa nyid du lta ba de dag ni bsgrub tu mi rung ba nyid yin par gsungs te /
translated: Those who view emptiness have been said to be incurable.

original: bsam gtan pa'i mgo la thod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa'i mgo la thod pa bzhin no //
translated: They are like the meditator whose head was split open.

original: de kho na nyid brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de kho na nyid brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the examination of reality.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'o /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu gsum pa'o / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: This is the thirteenth chapter.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Things certainly exist inherently.

original: 'jig rten na phrad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na phrad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because contact is seen in the world.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽sngar dbang po brtag par blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po gsum po dag la bya ba mi 'thad par yongs su brtags pa de dag nyid la gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir dang ni ji ltar phan tshun du phrad pa dang mi phrad par
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / sngar dbang po brtag par blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po gsum po dag la bya ba mi 'thad par yongs su brtags pa de dag nyid la gzhan nyid med pa'i phyir dang ni ji ltar phan tshun du phrad pa dang mi phrad par
translated: Here we say:🔽Previously, in the examination of the senses, it was thoroughly examined that the three—the object seen, seeing, and the seer—are untenable.

original: mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: mi 'thad pa de ltar bstan par bya ste /
translated: Just as mutual contact and noncontact are untenable, so it should be explained.

original: de la 'di snyam du rigs pa gang gis shen bshad pa /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du rigs pa gang gis shen bshad pa /
translated: In that regard, if you think, “By what reasoning is it explained?”

original: blta bya lta ba lta ba po //🔽gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
analyzed: blta bya lta ba lta ba po // gsum po de dag gnyis gnyis dang // thams cad kyang ni phan tshun du //
translated: The object seen, seeing, and the seer🔽These three do not exist🔽In mutual contact,

original: phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin //🔽blta bar bya ba ni dbang po'i don to //🔽lta ba ni dbang po'o //
analyzed: phrad par 'gyur ba yod ma yin // blta bar bya ba ni dbang po'i don to // lta ba ni dbang po'o //
translated: In all ways.🔽The object seen is the object of the sense faculty.

original: lta ba po ni bdag go //
analyzed: lta ba po ni bdag go //
translated: Seeing is the sense faculty.🔽The seer is the self.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po gsum po de dag ni gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po gsum po de dag ni gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun du phrad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The three—the object seen, seeing, and the seer—do not make mutual contact either in pairs or all together.

original: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur la /🔽blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur /🔽lta ba dang lta ba po yang 'phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur la / blta bar bya ba dang / lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur / lta ba dang lta ba po yang 'phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: The object seen and seeing do not make contact.🔽The object seen and the seer do not make contact.🔽Seeing and the seer do not make contact.

original: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po yang phrad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The object seen, seeing, and the seer do not make contact,

original: mar me dang mun pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mar me dang mun pa bzhin no //
translated: like a butter lamp and darkness.🔽Likewise, desire and the desirous one,

original: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par gyur dang nyon @59b mongs dang // lhag ma rnams kyang skye mched kyi //
analyzed: de bzhin 'dod chags chags pa dang // chags par gyur dang nyon @59b mongs dang // lhag ma rnams kyang skye mched kyi //
translated: the desirous one and the desirous, and the remaining afflictions

original: lhag ma'ang rnam pa gsum gyis lta //
analyzed: lhag ma'ang rnam pa gsum gyis lta //
translated: should be viewed in the same way as the remaining sources.

original: ji ltar blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar blta bar bya ba dang lta ba dang lta ba po dag gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the object seen, seeing, and the seer do not make mutual contact either in pairs or all together,

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur bdag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur te /🔽'dod chags dang chags pa yang phrad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang / chags par 'gyur bdag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur te / 'dod chags dang chags pa yang phrad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Desire, one who is desirous, and that which is to be desired do not make mutual contact in any of the three ways.🔽Desire and one who is desirous do not make contact.

original: 'dod chags dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur /🔽chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur / chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: Desire and that which is to be desired do not make contact.🔽One who is desirous and that which is to be desired do not make contact.

original: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang chags pa dang chags par 'gyur ba yang phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Desire, one who is desirous, and that which is to be desired do not make contact.

original: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams dang / skye mched kyi lhag ma sgra dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur bar rnam pa gsum gyis blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyon mongs pa lhag ma zhe sdang la sogs pa rnams dang / skye mched kyi lhag ma sgra dang / nyan pa po la sogs pa dag kyang gnyis gnyis dang thams cad kyang phan tshun lhan cig tu phrad par mi 'gyur bar rnam pa gsum gyis blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the remaining afflictions such as hatred, and the remaining sense bases such as sound and the hearer, do not make mutual contact in any of the three ways.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ci'i phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag phan tshun lhan cig phrad par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ci'i phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag phan tshun lhan cig phrad par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why don’t those such as the object seen mutually contact each other?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gzhan na gzhan dang phrad gyur na //
analyzed: gzhan na gzhan dang phrad gyur na //
translated: If one different from another were to contact it,

original: gang phyir blta bya la sogs la //
analyzed: gang phyir blta bya la sogs la //
translated: Then those such as the object seen

original: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa //
translated: Would not exist as different from it.

original: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore they would not contact each other.

original: 'di la de dag gzhan yin na gzhan dang phrad par 'gyur bar 'dod na /🔽gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la rigs pas rnam par brtags na /
analyzed: 'di la de dag gzhan yin na gzhan dang phrad par 'gyur bar 'dod na / gang gi phyir blta bar bya ba la sogs pa dag la rigs pas rnam par brtags na /
translated: If you assert that if they are different from each other, they would contact each other,🔽then those such as the object seen would not exist as different from each other

original: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan de yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir phrad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: when they are analyzed with reasoning. Therefore they would not contact each other.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
analyzed: blta bya la sogs 'ba' zhig la //
translated: Not only do those such as the object seen

original: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med par ma zad kyi //
translated: Not exist as different from each other,🔽But also it is untenable

original: gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu //🔽gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang yang gang dang lhan cig tu // gzhan pa nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: That anything is different from anything else.🔽Not only is it untenable that those such as the object seen are different from each other,

original: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag 'ba' zhig la phan tshun gzhan nyid mi 'thad par ma zad kyi /
analyzed: blta bar bya ba la sogs pa de dag 'ba' zhig la phan tshun gzhan nyid mi 'thad par ma zad kyi /
translated: but also it is untenable that anything is different from anything else.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gang yang dngos po gang dang lhan cig tu gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gang yang dngos po gang dang lhan cig tu gzhan nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: Thus, it is not tenable that any thing is different from any thing.

original: gzhan nyid med na gang yang gang dang yang lhan cig phrad par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan nyid med na gang yang gang dang yang lhan cig phrad par mi 'thad do //
translated: If difference does not exist, then it is not tenable that anything makes contact with anything.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: rigs pa gang gis gzhan nyid mi 'thad pa yin /
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis gzhan nyid mi 'thad pa yin /
translated: By what reasoning is difference not tenable?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan //🔽gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan la brten te gzhan // gzhan med gzhan las gzhan mi 'gyur //
translated: One thing is different in dependence on another.

original: gang la @60a * //
analyzed: gang la @60a * //
translated: Without another, one thing is not different from another.

original: brten te gang yin pa //
analyzed: brten te gang yin pa //
translated: That which is dependent

original: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
analyzed: de ni de las gzhan mi 'thad //
translated: is not tenable as different from it.

original: 'di la khyod gzhan zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig la brten te gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di la khyod gzhan zhes bya bar mngon par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni de las gzhan pa 'ga' zhig la brten te gzhan du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Here, that which you call “different” is different in dependence on something else.

original: gzhan med na gzhan ni rang las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan med na gzhan ni rang las gzhan du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Without another, one thing is not different from itself.

original: yang gzhan yang ;
analyzed: yang gzhan yang ;
translated: Moreover,

original: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba de ni de las gzhan yin par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang la brten te gang 'byung ba de ni de las gzhan yin par mi 'thad do //
translated: it is not tenable that that which arises in dependence on something is different from it.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: gal te gzhan yin par 'gyur na des skyon ci zhig tu thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gzhan yin par 'gyur na des skyon ci zhig tu thal bar 'gyur /
translated: If it were different, what error would ensue?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here Nāgārjuna explains:

original: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te gzhan ni gzhan las gzhan //
translated: If the other were different from the other,

original: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur// gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de //
analyzed: gzhan med par yang rung bar 'gyur// gzhan las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de //
translated: the other would be tenable without the other.🔽But if the other that is different from the other

original: med na med pas de'i phyir med //🔽gal te gang la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur ba de /
analyzed: med na med pas de'i phyir med // gal te gang la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur ba de /
translated: does not exist, it would not exist.🔽If that in dependence on which

original: de las gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
analyzed: de las gzhan yin par gyur na ni /
translated: the other becomes the other were different from it,

original: gzhan de med par yang de bzhin du rung bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan de med par yang de bzhin du rung bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'thad do //
translated: then the other would be tenable without the other. But that is untenable.

original: ci ste 'di snyam du gzhan ni gzhan la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
analyzed: ci ste 'di snyam du gzhan ni gzhan la brten nas gzhan du 'gyur bar sems na /
translated: But if you think that the other becomes the other in dependence on the other,

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gang las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de med na gzhan med pas rang nyid las gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan med pa kho nar shes par gyis shig /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gang las gzhan pa'i gzhan pa de med na gzhan med pas rang nyid las gzhan nyid du mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir gzhan med pa kho nar shes par gyis shig /'dir smras pa /
translated: then because the other that is different from the other does not exist without the other, the other would not be different from itself. Therefore, understand that the other does not exist at all.🔽Here someone might say:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gzhan nyid ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan nyid ces bya ba spyi gang yin pa de la ltos nas de gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba ni gzhan nyid ma yin mod kyi 'on kyang gzhan nyid ces bya ba spyi gang yin pa de la ltos nas de gzhan nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Dependent origination is not different, but rather, in dependence on that which is called “difference,” it becomes different.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gzhan nyid gzhan la yod ma yin //
translated: Here we say:🔽Difference does not exist in another,

original: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin la'ang yod ma yin //
translated: Nor does it exist in what is not another.

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If difference does not exist,

original: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan nam de nyid yod ma yin //
translated: Neither difference nor sameness exist.

original: khyod kyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba spyi gang yin pa de la ltos nas de gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa des na /
analyzed: khyod kyis gzhan nyid ces bya ba spyi gang yin pa de la ltos nas de gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes smras pa des na /
translated: You say that in dependence on that which is called “difference,” it becomes different.

original: de lta na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du smras pa ma yin nam /🔽gzhan yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de yang dngos po la brten cing ltos nas 'grub pa'i phyir de ni dngos po las gzhan la yang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta na rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba nyid du smras pa ma yin nam / gzhan yang gzhan nyid ces bya ba gang yin pa de yang dngos po la brten cing ltos nas 'grub pa'i phyir de ni dngos po las gzhan la yang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: But in that case, is it not said that it is dependent origination?

original: gzhan ma yin pa la yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa la yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, that which is called “difference” is established in dependence on things, therefore it does not exist in another thing, nor does it exist in what is not another thing.

original: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa de nyid du rnam par brtags pa de gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid yod pa ma yin na gzhan nam gzhan ma yin pa de nyid du rnam par brtags pa de gnyi ga yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If difference does not exist, then both the examination of difference and non-difference do not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
analyzed: de ni de dang phrad pa med //
translated: It does not contact itself.

original: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad mi 'gyur //
translated: Nor does it contact another.

original: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa @60b dang ; / phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
analyzed: phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa @60b dang ; / phrad pa po yang yod ma yin //
translated: That which is in the process of contacting, contact, and the contactor do not exist.

original: de nyid ni de dang phrad pa med de /
analyzed: de nyid ni de dang phrad pa med de /
translated: That very thing does not contact itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: gcig yin pa'i phyir te de nyid de dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig yin pa'i phyir te de nyid de dang phrad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is one, for that very thing does not contact itself.

original: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan yang phrad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does it contact another.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is different.

original: tha dad pa dag ni phrad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dag ni phrad par mi 'dod pa'i phyir dang dgos pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because different things are not accepted as contacting each other and because there is no purpose.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir yongs su brtags na dngos po rnams la phrad pa mi 'thad pa de'i phyir phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang phrad pa po yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir yongs su brtags na dngos po rnams la phrad pa mi 'thad pa de'i phyir phrad bzhin pa dang phrad pa dang phrad pa po yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: As such, since contact is untenable when things are thoroughly investigated, therefore that now contacting, contact, and the contactor do not exist.

original: gnam sa bzhin no //
analyzed: gnam sa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the sky and the earth.

original: phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phrad pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the examination of contact.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bzhi pa'o /
translated: This is the fourteenth chapter.

original: // / 'dir smras pa /🔽dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: // / 'dir smras pa / dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: so so'i bya ba byed nus par snang ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bum pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / snam bu'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i bya ba byed nus par snang ba'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bum pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / snam bu'i ngo bo nyid dag kyang rgyu dang rkyen rnams las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Things definitely exist essentially because they appear to be able to perform their own functions, and in the same way, the essence of a pot and the essence of a cloth arise from their own causes and conditions.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las //🔽'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / ngo bo nyid ni rgyu rkyen las // 'byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Here we say:🔽It is not tenable🔽That essence arises from causes and conditions.

original: ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that essence arises from causes and conditions.

original: de la 'di snyam du gal te ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar gyur na des skyon cir 'gyur snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de la 'di snyam du gal te ngo bo nyid rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar gyur na des skyon cir 'gyur snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think, “If an intrinsic reality arose from causes and conditions, what fault would there be?”

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / rgyu dang rkyen las byung ba yi //
translated: Here we say:🔽An intrinsic reality that arises

original: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byas par 'gyur //
translated: from causes and conditions would be created.

original: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar gyur na /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen rnams las byung bar gyur na /
translated: If it arose from causes and conditions,

original: ngo bo nyid byas pa yin pa'i skyon der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid byas pa yin pa'i skyon der 'gyur ro //
translated: the fault would be that intrinsic reality would be created.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid byas pa nyid yin par gyur na des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid byas pa nyid yin par gyur na des cir 'gyur /
translated: If intrinsic reality were created, what would be the problem?

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes //
translated: Here we say:🔽How could intrinsic reality

original: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na rung bar 'gyur //
translated: be suitable as created?🔽Intrinsic reality is not fabricated

original: ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni bcos min dang // gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin //
translated: and does not depend on another.

original: ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes bya bar ji ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni byas pa zhes bya bar ji ltar rung bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could intrinsic reality be suitable as created?

original: gang gi phyir ngo bo ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ngo bo ni bcos ma ma yin pa dang gzhan la ltos pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because intrinsic reality is not fabricated and does not depend on another.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na 'o na da gzhan gyi dngos po ni yod do //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na 'o na da gzhan gyi dngos po ni yod do //
translated: If there is no intrinsic reality, then extrinsic reality exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni yod min na //
translated: If intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod //🔽gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod // gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: How could extrinsic reality exist?🔽The intrinsic reality of extrinsic reality

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod //
translated: Is called “extrinsic reality.”

original: ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If intrinsic reality does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod do //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po ga la yod do //
translated: How could extrinsic reality exist?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo @61a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dngos po'i ngo bo @61a * //
translated: Because the intrinsic reality of extrinsic reality

original: nyid ni gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod na /
analyzed: nyid ni gzhan gyi dngos po yin zhes brjod na /
translated: Is called “extrinsic reality.”

original: ngo bo nyid de yang yongs su brtags na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid de yang yongs su brtags na /
translated: When that intrinsic reality is thoroughly investigated,

original: mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po yang med do //
analyzed: mi 'thad pa de'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po yang med do //
translated: It is untenable. Therefore, extrinsic reality also does not exist.

original: 'dir smras pa /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
