analyzed: mi spong ba dang 'dra bar bstan to //
translated: It is taught as being similar to non-rejection.

original: longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ba ni /🔽yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
analyzed: longs spyad pa las byung ba'i bsod nams zhes bya ba ni / yongs su longs spyod pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // bsod nams ma yin tshul de bzhin //
translated: The merit that arises from enjoyment is the merit that arises from the cause of enjoyment.

original: zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yongs su longs spyad pa'i rgyu las byung ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The demerit is the demerit that arises from the cause of enjoyment.

original: sems pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems pa zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The volition is the manifest action.

original: chos de bdun las su mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos de bdun las su mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: These seven factors are the manifest action.

original: zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na chos bdun po de dag ni las mngon par byed pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdu na chos bdun po de dag ni las mngon par byed pa yin par bstan te /
translated: In brief, these seven factors are taught as the manifest action.

original: las su mngon par byed pa ni de dag gi las yin par mngon pa dang / gsal ba dang / gzung ba dang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: las su mngon par byed pa ni de dag gi las yin par mngon pa dang / gsal ba dang / gzung ba dang mtshon par byed pa yin no //
translated: The manifest action is the action of these seven factors, because it is manifest, clear, apprehended, and indicated.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir las de lta bu dag gi 'bras bu 'di dang gzhan du 'byung bar bstan pa de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pas dngos po thams cad stong pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir las de lta bu dag gi 'bras bu 'di dang gzhan du 'byung bar bstan pa de'i phyir las dang 'bras bu rnam par bzhag pas dngos po thams cad stong pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, because the effects of such actions are taught to arise in this life and in other lives, therefore, all things are not empty because the presentation of actions and effects is not undermined.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
analyzed: gal te smin pa'i dus bar du //
translated: If it endures until the time of ripening,

original: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //
analyzed: gnas na las de rtag par 'gyur //
translated: that action would be permanent.

original: gal te 'gag na 'gag gyur pas //
analyzed: gal te 'gag na 'gag gyur pas //
translated: If it ceases, then having ceased,

original: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur //
translated: how could it generate an effect?

original: 'di la las gnas pa'am 'gag pa zhig 'bras bu skyed par gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di la las gnas pa'am 'gag pa zhig 'bras bu skyed par gyur grang na /
translated: Here, if an action endures or ceases, it would generate an effect.

original: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad do //
translated: But in both cases, that is untenable.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: re zhig gal te las smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas na /
analyzed: re zhig gal te las smin pa'i dus kyi bar du gnas na /
translated: First, if it endures until the time of ripening,

original: de ltar na rtag par gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de ltar na rtag par gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: then it would be permanent. But that is unacceptable.

original: gal te 'gag par sems na /
analyzed: gal te 'gag par sems na /
translated: If you think it ceases,

original: 'gag par gyur pa ni med pa yin pas ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'gag par gyur pa ni med pa yin pas ji ltar 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur /
translated: then having ceased, it would be nonexistent. So how could it generate an effect?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here the opponent says:

original: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs rgyun gang ni //
translated: The continuum of the sprout and so on

original: sa bon las ni mngon par byung //
analyzed: sa bon las ni mngon par byung //
translated: It arises from the seed.

original: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sa bon ni //
translated: From that, the effect.

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: If the seed did not exist, that would not arise.🔽Because the continuum arises from the seed,

original: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir sa bon las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon 'gro ba //
translated: and the seed precedes the effect,

original: de phyir chad min rtag pa min //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag pa min //
translated: therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'di la sa bon ni myu gu'i rgyun bskyed nas 'gag go //
analyzed: 'di la sa bon ni myu gu'i rgyun bskyed nas 'gag go //
translated: Here, the seed ceases after producing the continuum of the sprout.

original: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni @65a * //
analyzed: myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun gang yin pa de ni @65a * //
translated: The continuum of the sprout, etc.

original: sa bon las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyu de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sa bon las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyu de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: arises from the seed. The effect arises from that cause.

original: sa bon med na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bon med na myu gu la sogs pa'i rgyun de mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If the seed did not exist, that continuum of the sprout, etc. would not arise.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon las rgyun mngon par 'byung la rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon las rgyun mngon par 'byung la rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing sa bon 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: Because the continuum arises from the seed, and the effect arises from the continuum, and the seed precedes the effect, therefore, it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon rnam pa thams cad du chad nas rgyun byung ba ma yin gyi /🔽rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon rnam pa thams cad du chad nas rgyun byung ba ma yin gyi / rgyun gyis rjes su 'jug pa de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the seed does not arise from a continuum that is completely cut off,🔽and because it arises from a continuum that is not cut off, therefore it is not annihilated.

original: gang gi phyir sa bon 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa bon 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: And because the seed ceases and does not endure, therefore it is not eternal.

original: de ji lta ba de bzhin du /🔽sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //
analyzed: de ji lta ba de bzhin du / sems kyi rgyun ni gang yin pa //
translated: Just as it is with the seed,🔽so it is with the continuum of mind.

original: sems pa las ni mngon par 'byung //
analyzed: sems pa las ni mngon par 'byung //
translated: The continuum arises from intention,

original: de las 'bras bu sems pa ni //
analyzed: de las 'bras bu sems pa ni //
translated: and from it arises the effect.

original: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: med na de yang 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: If there were no intention, the continuum would not arise.

original: gang phyir sems pa las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: gang phyir sems pa las rgyun dang // rgyun las 'bras bu 'byung 'gyur zhing //
translated: Because the continuum arises from intention, and the effect arises from the continuum,

original: las ni 'bras bu sngon 'gro ba //
analyzed: las ni 'bras bu sngon 'gro ba //
translated: and the action precedes the effect,

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa de ni sems pa las su brjod pa gang yin pa 'gag bzhin pa de las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyun de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun gang yin pa de ni sems pa las su brjod pa gang yin pa 'gag bzhin pa de las mngon par 'byung zhing rgyun de las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung ngo //
translated: The continuum of mind arises from the intention that is said to be the action, and from that continuum the effect arises.

original: sems pa med na sems kyi rgyun de yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems pa med na sems kyi rgyun de yang mngon par 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no intention, that continuum of mind would not manifest.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa las su brjod pa las sems kyi rgyun mngon par 'byung la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa las su brjod pa las sems kyi rgyun mngon par 'byung la /
translated: Because the continuum of mind manifests from what is called “intention,”

original: sems kyi rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing las dang 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun las 'bras bu mngon par 'byung bar 'gyur zhing las dang 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba de'i phyir chad pa dang rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: and the effect manifests from the continuum of mind, and that which precedes the effect and the cause is not annihilated, therefore there is no annihilation and no eternalism.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag bzhin pa las sems kyi rgyun 'byung gi sems pa rnam pa thams cad du 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag bzhin pa las sems kyi rgyun 'byung gi sems pa rnam pa thams cad du 'gag par mi 'gyur ba de'i phyir chad pa ma yin la /
translated: Because the continuum of mind arises from intention that is ceasing, and intention does not cease in every way, therefore there is no annihilation.

original: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sems pa 'gag cing nges par mi gnas pa de'i phyir rtag pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because intention ceases and definitely does not endure, therefore there is no eternalism.

original: de'i phyir de ltar rgyun gyis 'bras bu 'grub pas na 'khor ba yang 'thad la rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar rgyun gyis 'bras bu 'grub pas na 'khor ba yang 'thad la rtag pa dang chad pa'i skyon du yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, in this way, because the effect is established through the continuum, samsara is tenable, and the errors of eternalism and annihilationism do not follow.

original: chos de sgrub pa'i thabs rnams ni gang yin /
analyzed: chos de sgrub pa'i thabs rnams ni gang yin /
translated: What are the means for accomplishing that Dharma?

original: 'bras bu ni gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu ni gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its result?🔽It is said:

original: smras pa / chos bsgrub pa yi thabs rnams ni //
analyzed: smras pa / chos bsgrub pa yi thabs rnams ni //
translated: The means for accomplishing Dharma

original: dkar po'i @65b las kyi lam bcu ste //
analyzed: dkar po'i @65b las kyi lam bcu ste //
translated: are the ten virtuous karmic paths.

original: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du //
analyzed: chos kyi 'bras bu 'di gzhan du //
translated: The result of Dharma is

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan rnam lnga'o //
translated: the five sense-qualities in this and other lives.

original: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bsgrub pa'i thabs ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yin par bstan la /
analyzed: 'di la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos bsgrub pa'i thabs ni dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yin par bstan la /
translated: Here the Bhagavān taught that the means for accomplishing Dharma are the ten virtuous karmic paths.

original: de'i 'bras bu yang 'di dang gzhan du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag yin par bstan te /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu yang 'di dang gzhan du 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga po dag yin par bstan te /
translated: He taught that their result is the five sense-qualities in this and other lives.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de ni de tsam nyid kyis rnam par bshad pas chog ste /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de ni de tsam nyid kyis rnam par bshad pas chog ste /
translated: This verse is sufficient to explain that.

original: 'phros par thal na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phros par thal na mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is expanded, it is not suitable.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir chos bsgrub pa'i thabs dang chos kyi 'bras bu bstan pa de'i phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yang yod la rtag pa dang chad par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir chos bsgrub pa'i thabs dang chos kyi 'bras bu bstan pa de'i phyir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa yang yod la rtag pa dang chad par yang thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because the means for accomplishing Dharma and the result of Dharma are taught, therefore karma and its result exist and the errors of eternalism and nihilism do not occur.

original: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis smras pa /
translated: Others say:

original: gal te brtag pa der gyur na //
analyzed: gal te brtag pa der gyur na //
translated: If that were the case,

original: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur //🔽de lta bas na brtag pa de //
analyzed: nyes pa chen po mang por 'gyur // de lta bas na brtag pa de //
translated: many great errors would arise.🔽Therefore,

original: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: that analysis is not tenable here.

original: gal te khyod kyi las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba bsgrub pa dper na sa bon dang myu gu'i rgyun 'brel pa bstan pa'i brtag pa de ltar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te khyod kyi las dang 'bras bur 'brel ba bsgrub pa dper na sa bon dang myu gu'i rgyun 'brel pa bstan pa'i brtag pa de ltar gyur na /
translated: If the analysis of the connection between karma and its result were like the presentation of the connection between the continuum of a seed and a sprout,

original: de la nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de la nyes pa'i skyon chen po mang du 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: many great errors would arise.

original: brtag pa de 'dir 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: brtag pa de 'dir 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that analysis is not tenable here.

original: gtan tshigs des 'dir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa dag mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des 'dir las dang 'bras bur 'brel pa dag mi 'thad de /
translated: That reason is not tenable here for the connection between karma and its result.

original: 'phros pa spangs pa'i phyir rgyas par mi brjod do //
analyzed: 'phros pa spangs pa'i phyir rgyas par mi brjod do //
translated: Because it is an elaboration, it is not stated extensively.

original: 'o na ji lta bur 'thad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta bur 'thad ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it tenable?🔽It is said:🔽Whatever was taught by the buddhas, pratyekabuddhas,

original: smras pa / sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gang gsungs pa //🔽brtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //
analyzed: smras pa / sangs rgyas rnams dang rang rgyal dang // nyan thos rnams kyis gang gsungs pa // brtag pa gang zhig 'dir 'thad pa //
translated: and śrāvakas,🔽that analysis is tenable here.

original: de ni rab tu brjod par bya //
analyzed: de ni rab tu brjod par bya //
translated: That will be fully explained.

original: de yang gang zhe na smras pa /🔽ji ltar bu lon dpang rgya ltar //
analyzed: de yang gang zhe na smras pa / ji ltar bu lon dpang rgya ltar //
translated: What is that?

original: de ltar las dang chud mi za //
analyzed: de ltar las dang chud mi za //
translated: Karma and nonexpiration are like a promissory note and a written contract.🔽Karma should be viewed like a promissory note and nonexpiration should be viewed like a written contract.

original: bu lon ji lta ba de ltar ni las blta bar bya la //🔽dpang rgya ji lta ba de ltar ni chud mi za ba ba blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: bu lon ji lta ba de ltar ni las blta bar bya la // dpang rgya ji lta ba de ltar ni chud mi za ba ba blta bar bya ste /
translated: Just as a promissory note is a cause for the creditor to obtain wealth, so too is karma.🔽Just as a written contract is a cause for the creditor to obtain wealth that is not lost, so too is nonexpiration.

original: dper na bu lon gyi nor de spyad kyang dpang rgya yod pas nor bdag gi nor chud mi za zhing nor gyi phung po skyeg dang bcas par 'ong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dper na bu lon gyi nor de spyad kyang dpang rgya yod pas nor bdag gi nor chud mi za zhing nor gyi phung po skyeg dang bcas par 'ong ba de bzhin du /
translated: For example, when wealth is used as a loan, the wealth of the creditor is not lost because of the promissory note and the wealth of the debtor increases with interest.

original: las skad cig ma 'gags su zin kyang de'i rgyu las byung ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos yod pas byed pa po'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za zhing 'bras bu khyad par dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las skad cig ma 'gags su zin kyang de'i rgyu las byung ba chud mi za ba zhes bya ba'i chos yod pas byed pa po'i las kyi 'bras bu chud mi za zhing 'bras bu khyad par dang bcas pa 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Similarly, although the moment of karma ceases, because the phenomenon called nonexpiration of karma arises from that cause, the result of the karma of the agent is not lost and the result increases with interest.

original: ji ltar nor bdag gis nor phyir zhugs na bu lon gyi dpang rgya rong 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa pos 'bras bu @66a * //
analyzed: ji ltar nor bdag gis nor phyir zhugs na bu lon gyi dpang rgya rong 'gyur ba de ltar byed pa pos 'bras bu @66a * //
translated: Just as the creditor obtains wealth from the debtor by means of the promissory note, so too the agent obtains the result of karma from the debtor of karma by means of the nonexpiration of karma.

original: myong na chud mi za ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myong na chud mi za ba yang de bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were to be experienced, it would be like that.

original: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi //
analyzed: de ni khams las rnam pa bzhi //
translated: It is of four types, according to realm.

original: chud mi za ba de ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa dang zag pa med pa'i khams kyi bye brag las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chud mi za ba de ni 'dod pa dang gzugs dang gzugs med par rtogs pa dang zag pa med pa'i khams kyi bye brag las rnam pa bzhir 'gyur ro //
translated: That nonexpiration is of four types, according to the distinction of the realms of desire, form, and formlessness, and the uncontaminated realm.

original: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin lung ma bstan //
translated: It is neutral by nature.

original: chud mi za ba de yang rang bzhin gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du brda mi sprod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: chud mi za ba de yang rang bzhin gyis dge ba dang mi dge ba nyid du brda mi sprod pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin te /
translated: That nonexpiration is neutral by nature, because it does not convey the designation of virtue or nonvirtue.

original: skyon de dag yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skyon de dag yongs su spangs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is completely free of those faults,

original: rang bzhin lung du ma bstan par rnam par bzhag go //
analyzed: rang bzhin lung du ma bstan par rnam par bzhag go //
translated: it is established as neutral by nature.

original: de dag kyang chos mngon pa las shes par bya ba yin pas 'phros pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir mi brjod do //
analyzed: de dag kyang chos mngon pa las shes par bya ba yin pas 'phros pa yongs su spang pa'i phyir mi brjod do //
translated: Since it is to be known from the Abhidharma, it is not mentioned here in order to avoid digression.

original: spong bas spang ba ma yin te //
analyzed: spong bas spang ba ma yin te //
translated: It is not abandoned by the path of vision,

original: bsgom pas spang ba nyid kyang yin //
analyzed: bsgom pas spang ba nyid kyang yin //
translated: but it is also abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: chud mi za ba de ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas spang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chud mi za ba de ni sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas spang ba ma yin te /
translated: That nonexpiration is not eliminated by the elimination of objects to be eliminated by the path of seeing such as suffering.

original: 'bras bu 'pho ba na bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang ba dang / 'bras bu skyed pas kyang spang ba nyid yin no //🔽de phyir chud mi za ba yis //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'pho ba na bsgom pa'i lam gyis spang ba dang / 'bras bu skyed pas kyang spang ba nyid yin no // de phyir chud mi za ba yis //
translated: When the effect is transferred, it is eliminated by the path of meditation and it is eliminated by generating the effect.🔽Therefore, the effect of karma

original: las kyi 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: las kyi 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur //
translated: is generated by nonexpiration.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas spang ba ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las mi dge ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir de ltar sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong bas spang ba ma yin pa de'i phyir sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i las mi dge ba bzhin du /
translated: Thus, because it is not eliminated by the elimination of objects to be eliminated by the path of seeing such as suffering,

original: las spangs su zin kyang chud mi za bas las rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las spangs su zin kyang chud mi za bas las rnams kyi 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: even though karma is eliminated, the effect of karma is generated by nonexpiration.

original: gal te spong bas spang ba dang // las 'pho ba dang mthun gyur na //🔽de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: gal te spong bas spang ba dang // las 'pho ba dang mthun gyur na // de la las 'jig la sogs pa'i //
translated: If elimination were eliminated by elimination🔽and karma were transferred to accord with it,🔽then the errors

original: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: skyon rnams su ni thal bar 'gyur //
translated: of the destruction of karma and so on would ensue.

original: de la gal te chud mi za ba de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i spang ba dang las 'gag cing 'pho ba dang / rigs mthun pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de la gal te chud mi za ba de sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba spong ba'i spang ba dang las 'gag cing 'pho ba dang / rigs mthun pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If that nonexpiration is the abandonment of objects to be abandoned by seeing the truths of suffering and so on, then the karma that is abandoned would cease and be transferred when the karma is relinquished and changed.

analyzed: gcig pu kho na skye bar 'gyur ro // tshe 'di la ni las dang las //

analyzed: zag pa med pa dang / zag pa dang bcas pa'i las kyi bye brag gis so //

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gzhi med pa la bsam pa de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te las ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /
analyzed: gal te las ji ltar mi 'thad ce na /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: gang phyir de ni ma skyes pa //

analyzed: de phyir chud zar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: gal te las la dngos po yod //

translated: There is no doubt that this would contradict all conventions such as “this is winter” and “this is spring,”

translated: Moreover:🔽The distinction between the one who creates

analyzed: 'di ni bsod nams byed pa pho 'di ni sdig pa byed do zhes bya ba'i rnam par dbye ba de dag kyang 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: yang dang yang du rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu gzhan dag smin par 'gyur te /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir las ngo bo nyid kyis nges par gnas pa de'i phyir ngo bo nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa / las ni yod pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: las kyi rgyu nyon mongs pa dag yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: las ni nyon mongs bdag nyid na //

original: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //
analyzed: nyon mongs de dag yang dag min //

original: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs yang dag min //

analyzed: las ni de yis ji ltar byas //

analyzed: las ni nyon mongs pa'i rgyu las byung ba yin na nyon mongs pa de dag ni skye ba med pa'i phyir dang / ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / brten nas byung ba'i phyir yang dag pa ma yin pas /

analyzed: gal te de ltar nyon mongs pa de dag yang dag pa ma yin na //

analyzed: 'o na las dang nyon mongs pa des ji ltar byas par 'gyur te /

analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu las dang lus kyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir dang / las kyi 'bras bu lus kyi mtshan nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, we reply:

original: las @68b dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //
analyzed: las @68b dang nyon mongs pa dag ni //

original: lus rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //
analyzed: lus rnams kyi ni rkyen du bstan //

original: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: gal te las dang nyon mongs pa //

original: de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //
analyzed: de stong lus la ji ltar brjod //

analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu yod pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa ni /

analyzed: bstan bcos las las dang nyon mongs pa dag lus rnams kyi rkyen du bstan pa ni tha snyad pa yin gyi don dam pa ni ma yin te /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: las dang nyon mongs pa dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa dag la ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir /

original: de dag gi 'bras bu lus kyang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu lus kyang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because their effects, the bodies, are also devoid of essence.

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here you may say,

original: las ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: las ni yod pa kho na yin te /

analyzed: de'i 'bras bu la longs spyod pa'i za ba po yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the experiencer of its effects exists.”

original: gal te de ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: gal te de ji ltar shes she na /
translated: If you ask how this is known,🔽it is said:

original: smras pa / ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
analyzed: smras pa / ma rig bsgribs pa'i skye bo gang //
translated: The person obscured by ignorance,

original: sred ldan de ni za ba po //
analyzed: sred ldan de ni za ba po //
translated: Who is desirous, is the experiencer.

original: de yang byed las gzhan min zhing //
analyzed: de yang byed las gzhan min zhing //
translated: And it is not the case that the agent is not different from the action,

original: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that it is that itself.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i mdo dag las /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i mdo dag las /
translated: The Bhagavān said in the sūtras on the absence of beginning and end:🔽Sentient beings obscured by ignorance,

original: ma rig bsgribs pa'i sems can dag / sred pa kun du sbyor dang ldan //
analyzed: ma rig bsgribs pa'i sems can dag / sred pa kun du sbyor dang ldan //
translated: Possessing the fetter of craving.

original: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du ji ste khyod rang nyid kyis sdig pa'i las 'di byas na khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so zhes kyang gsungs la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du ji ste khyod rang nyid kyis sdig pa'i las 'di byas na khyod rang nyid kyis de'i rnam par smin pa nyams su myong bar bya dgos so zhes kyang gsungs la /
translated: And similarly, if you yourself commit this sinful action, you yourself must experience its ripening.

original: de yang byed pa po las gzhan ma yin zhing de nyid de yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang byed pa po las gzhan ma yin zhing de nyid de yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not the case that the agent is different from the action, nor is it the case that it is that itself.

original: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: Since it cannot be said to be either the same or different,

original: de'i phyir las kyang yod pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir las kyang yod pa kho na yin no //
translated: therefore action alone exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang gi phyir na las 'di ni //🔽rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir na las 'di ni // rkyen las byung ba ma yin zhing ;
translated: Because this action🔽Does not arise from conditions

original: / rkyen min las byung yod min pa //
analyzed: / rkyen min las byung yod min pa //
translated: And does not arise from nonconditions,

original: de phyir byed pa po yang med //
analyzed: de phyir byed pa po yang med //
translated: Therefore the agent also does not exist.

original: byed pa po de yang las de bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir las dang byed pa po med do //
analyzed: byed pa po de yang las de bzhin du ma skyes pa'i phyir dang / byed pa po bkag pa'i phyir dang / rdzas su yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir las dang byed pa po med do //
translated: Also, because the agent is not produced in the same way as the action, because the agent is refuted, and because it does not substantially exist, the action and agent do not exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: gal te las dang byed med na //
analyzed: gal te las dang byed med na //
translated: if action and agent do not exist,

original: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //
analyzed: las skyes 'bras bu ga la yod //

original: ji ste 'bras bu yod min na //
analyzed: ji ste 'bras bu yod min na //
translated: If the result does not exist,

original: za ba po lta ga la yod //
analyzed: za ba po lta ga la yod //
translated: how could there be an experiencer?

original: gal te brtags na las kyang med la byed pa po yang med na las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ga la yod //
analyzed: gal te brtags na las kyang med la byed pa po yang med na las las skyes pa'i 'bras bu ga la yod //
translated: If, upon investigation, action and agent do not exist, how could there be a result arisen from action?

original: ji ste 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ji ste 'bras bu yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If the result does not exist,

original: za ba po lta ga la yod de /🔽zab po'i sgrar @69a * //
analyzed: za ba po lta ga la yod de / zab po'i sgrar @69a * //
translated: how could there be an experiencer?

original: brjod pa nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa nyid kyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term “experiencer” is itself without cause.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: ji byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang zab po dang las dang nyon mongs pa dag med do zhes bya ba de shin tu nges pa yin nam /
analyzed: ji byed pa po dang las dang 'bras bu dang zab po dang las dang nyon mongs pa dag med do zhes bya ba de shin tu nges pa yin nam /
translated: “Is it certain that the agent, action, result, experiencer, action, and affliction do not exist?”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, Nāgārjuna explains,

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de la yod do //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba de la yod do //
translated: That which is dependently arisen has no intrinsic reality.

original: zhe'am med do zhes bya ba smra bar ga la rigs te /
analyzed: zhe'am med do zhes bya ba smra bar ga la rigs te /
translated: How could it be right to say of that which is dependently arisen that it exists or that it does not exist?🔽In order to stop the grasping of things in this way, this example should be grasped:

analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pa bzlog pa'i phyir dpe 'di zung shig / ji ltar sprul pa ston byed pa //

analyzed: rdzu 'phrul phun sum tshogs pa yis // sprul zhing sprul pa'ang gzhan sprul byed //

original: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
analyzed: sprul pa des kyang gzhan dag ltar //
translated: And that emanated by the first emanates yet others,🔽So too the creator of the emanation

analyzed: de bzhin byed pos las gang byas // de yang sprul pa'i rnam pa bzhin //
translated: Is like the emanated one.🔽Just as an emanation emanates another emanation,

analyzed: dper na sprul pas sprul gzhan zhig / sprul pa mdzad pa de bzhin no //
translated: So too the creator of the emanation is like the emanated one.🔽Afflictions, actions, bodies,🔽Agents, and effects🔽Are like a city of gandharvas,

original: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
analyzed: nyon mongs las dang lus rnams dang // byed pa po dang 'bras bu dag / dri za'i grong khyer lta bu dang / smig rgyu rmi lam 'dra ba yin //
translated: Like a mirage, like a dream.

original: chos thams cad de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: All phenomena should be viewed in this way.

original: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the examination of action and effect.

original: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa bcu bdun pa'o /
translated: This is the seventeenth chapter.

original: // / bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga pa /
translated: Chapter 5🔽

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: 'o na de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni gang yin /
analyzed: 'o na de kho na'i mtshan nyid ni gang yin /
translated: What is the characteristic of reality?

original: rnam pa gang gis ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: By what aspect is reality understood?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin la /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin la /
translated: The characteristic of reality is freedom from “I” and “mine.”

original: rigs pa sngon du btang ste yongs su rtogs pa ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs pa sngon du btang ste yongs su rtogs pa ni de kho na rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Reality is understood by means of prior reasoning.

original: gal te ji ltar zhen bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhen bshad pa /
translated: If you ask, how?

original: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
analyzed: gal te phung po bdag yin na //
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye dang 'jig pa can du 'gyur //
translated: it would have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: gal te phung po rnams bdag nyid yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams bdag nyid yin par gyur na /
translated: If the aggregates were the self,

original: de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

analyzed: phung po rnams ni skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aggregates have the attributes of arising and disintegrating.

original: bdag skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin na /
analyzed: bdag skye ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin na /
translated: If the self had the attributes of arising and disintegrating,

original: mi rtag pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de rab tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi rtag pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de rab tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the error of impermanence would follow.

analyzed: de ni 'phros pa spangs pa'i phyir mi brjod do //
translated: This is not stated to avoid elaboration.

original: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams las gzhan //
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,

original: phung po mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
analyzed: phung po mtshan nyid med par 'gyur //
translated: the self would lack the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: gal te bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te bdag phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na /
translated: If the self were different from the aggregates,

original: de lta na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: it would lack the characteristics of the aggregates.

original: phung po rnams las gzhan pa ni rtag pa yin pa'i @69b phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan pa ni rtag pa yin pa'i @69b phyir ro //
translated: This is because that which is different from the aggregates would be permanent.

original: bdag phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin na rtag pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de dag tu thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag phung po'i mtshan nyid ma yin na rtag pa'i skyon gang dag yin pa de dag tu thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the self lacked the characteristics of the aggregates, the errors of permanence would ensue.

original: de yang 'phros pa spangs pa'i phyir mi brjod do //
analyzed: de yang 'phros pa spangs pa'i phyir mi brjod do //
translated: This is not stated to avoid elaboration.

original: de ltar gang gi phyir yongs su brtags na bdag gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir yongs su brtags na bdag gnyi ga ltar yang mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, because when investigated, the self is untenable in both ways,

original: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
analyzed: bdag nyid yod pa ma yin na //
translated: If the self does not exist,

original: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur //
translated: how could “mine” exist?

original: brtags na de ltar bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad na bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: brtags na de ltar bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad du mi 'thad na bdag gi yod par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: When investigated in this way, if the self is untenable in every way, how could “mine” exist?

original: 'di ltar bdag cis bya ba'i gang yin pa de bdag gi zhes bya ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag cis bya ba'i gang yin pa de bdag gi zhes bya ba na /
translated: Thus, if something is “mine” because it is “mine” in the sense of being something that is to be used by the self,
