analyzed: bdag de med pas de'i 'di yin no zhes bya ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then since the self does not exist, it is not tenable to say that this is “mine.”

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag gi med pa ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag gi med pa ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the absence of the self and “mine” is the characteristic of reality.

original: bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi zhi ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the self and “mine” are pacified,

original: ngar 'dzin nga yid 'dzin med 'gyur //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yid 'dzin med 'gyur //
translated: there is no grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir de la ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir de la ngar 'dzin pa dang / nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, because the manifest clinging to the self and “mine” is pacified, there is no grasping of “I” and “mine.”

original: 'di ltar bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la brten nas ngar 'dzin par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag tu mngon par zhen pa la brten nas ngar 'dzin par 'gyur la /
translated: For, on the basis of manifest clinging to the self, there is grasping of “I.”

original: bdag gir mngon par zhen pa la brten nas nga yir 'dzin par 'gyur pas /
analyzed: bdag gir mngon par zhen pa la brten nas nga yir 'dzin par 'gyur pas /
translated: And on the basis of manifest clinging to “mine,” there is grasping of “mine.”

original: gang gi phyir bdag tu mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba de'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag tu mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba de'i phyir ngar 'dzin pa med par 'gyur la /
translated: Therefore, because the manifest clinging to the self is pacified, there is no grasping of “I.”

original: bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba de'i phyir nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gir mngon par zhen pa nye bar zhi ba de'i phyir nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the pacification of the clinging to “mine,” the grasping at “mine” does not occur.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: gang gis de ltar de kho na mthong na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid bdag yin pas bdag yod pa'i phyir bdag gi yang yod do //
analyzed: gang gis de ltar de kho na mthong na ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de nyid bdag yin pas bdag yod pa'i phyir bdag gi yang yod do //
translated: “Since the one who sees reality in that way is the self, the self exists because of the existence of the grasping at ‘I’ and ‘mine.’ ”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, we reply:

original: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med gang //
translated: The one who is without the grasping at “I” and “mine”

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te //🔽ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te // ngar 'dzin nga yir 'dzin med par //
translated: Does not exist.🔽The one who sees without the grasping at “I” and “mine”

original: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang gis mthong bas mi mthong ngo //
translated: Does not see.

original: de ltar ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, the one who is called “the one who is without the grasping at ‘I’ and ‘mine’” does not exist.

original: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par gang gis mthong bas log par lta bas blo gros kyi mig nyams pa des ni de kho na mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: ngar 'dzin pa dang nga yir 'dzin pa med par gang gis mthong bas log par lta bas blo gros kyi mig nyams pa des ni de kho na mi mthong ngo //
translated: The one who sees without the grasping at “I” and “mine” does not see reality because the eye of his intelligence is impaired by the wrong view.

original: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
analyzed: nang dang phyi rol nyid dag la //
translated: The one who sees without the grasping at “I” and “mine”🔽Does not see.

original: bdag dang bdag gir zad gyur na //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gir zad gyur na //
translated: When “mine” and “I” are exhausted,

original: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'gag 'gyur zhing //
translated: appropriation ceases.

original: de zad pas na skye ba zad //🔽de ltar na nga nyid la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang / phyi @70a * //
analyzed: de zad pas na skye ba zad // de ltar na nga nyid la bdag tu mngon par zhen pa dang / phyi @70a * //
translated: When that is exhausted, birth is exhausted.

original: rol nyid la bdag gir mngon par zhen pa zad par gyur na /
analyzed: rol nyid la bdag gir mngon par zhen pa zad par gyur na /
translated: Thus, when attachment to “I” in relation to oneself and attachment to “mine” in relation to external objects are exhausted,

original: nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi 'gag par 'gyur zhing de 'gags pas srid pa zad par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnam pa bzhi 'gag par 'gyur zhing de 'gags pas srid pa zad par 'gyur la /
translated: the four types of appropriation cease, and when that ceases, existence is exhausted.

original: srid pa zad pas skye bzad par 'gyur ba de ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i 'bras bu nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa zad pas skye bzad par 'gyur ba de ni gang zag la bdag med pa'i de kho na rtogs pa'i 'bras bu nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba phung po'i lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: When existence is exhausted, birth is exhausted. This is the result of realizing the reality of the selflessness of persons, which is distinguished by the elimination of the obscurations of affliction, and it is nirvāṇa with remainder.

original: da ni chos bdag med pa'i de kho na rtog pa'i 'bras bu shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: da ni chos bdag med pa'i de kho na rtog pa'i 'bras bu shes bya'i sgrib pa spangs pas rab tu phye ba'i phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i thabs bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Now, in order to teach the method of attaining nirvana without remainder of the aggregates, which is distinguished by the abandonment of the obscurations to omniscience, which is the result of the realization of the reality of the selflessness of phenomena, it is said:

original: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs zad pas thar //
translated: Liberation is by the exhaustion of karma and afflictions.

original: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs rnam rtog las //
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality.

original: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
analyzed: de dag spros las spros pa ni //
translated: Those arise from mental fabrication. Mental fabrication

original: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: Ceaselessly ceases by emptiness.

original: 'di la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag zad pas sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ni thar pa ste /
analyzed: 'di la las dang nyon mongs pa dag ni skye ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir de dag zad pas sdug bsngal las rnam par grol ba ni thar pa ste /
translated: Here, liberation is the freedom from suffering by the exhaustion of karma and afflictions, because they are the causes of birth.

original: des ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: des ni phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug par bstan to //
translated: This teaches the entry into the realm of nirvana with remainder.

original: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: las dang nyon mongs pa de dag ni rnam par rtog pa las 'byung ste /
translated: Karma and afflictions arise from conceptuality,

original: de dag yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag yod na 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they arise when those exist.

original: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni spros pa las 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa de dag ni spros pa las 'byung ste /
translated: These conceptualizations arise from conceptual elaboration.

original: tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi bden pa la mngon par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi spros pa las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They arise from the conceptual elaboration that consists in the habitual adherence to the conventional truth.

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Conceptual elaboration ceases through emptiness.

original: chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa nyid kyi mtshan nyid rtogs pas 'gag par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It ceases through the realization of the reality of the insubstantiality of the dharmas.

original: de ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug par bstan to //
analyzed: de ni phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings su 'jug par bstan to //
translated: This is the entry into the sphere of Nirvana without a remaining substratum.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The self certainly exists,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag yod par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag yod par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the Lord has declared the existence of the self.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / bdag go zhes kyang btags gyur cing //
translated: Here it is said:🔽It is designated as the self,

original: bdag med ces kyang bstan par 'gyur //
analyzed: bdag med ces kyang bstan par 'gyur //
translated: and it is taught that it is not the self.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis bdag dang ni //
translated: The Buddhas have taught that the self

original: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //
analyzed: bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan //
translated: is neither existent nor non-existent.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal mkhyen pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das sems can rnams kyi bsam pa dang bag la nyal mkhyen pa la mkhas pa rnams kyis /
translated: The Lord Buddha, who is skilled in knowing the thoughts and inclinations of sentient beings,

original: gdul ba de dang de dag la yang dag par gzigs nas /
analyzed: gdul ba de dang de dag la yang dag par gzigs nas /
translated: having seen those to be trained,

original: gdul ba gang dag la 'jig rten 'di med @70b do //
analyzed: gdul ba gang dag la 'jig rten 'di med @70b do //
translated: to some to be trained, he said, “This world does not exist.”

original: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol med do //
translated: “The world beyond does not exist.”🔽“There are no sentient beings who are born supernaturally.”

original: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do snyam pa'i lta ba de lta bu byung bar gyur pa de dag gi bdag med par lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag go zhes kyang btags par gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can rdzus te skye ba med do snyam pa'i lta ba de lta bu byung bar gyur pa de dag gi bdag med par lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir bdag go zhes kyang btags par gyur ro //
translated: In order to reverse the view of those who have such a view, he said, “There is a self.”🔽To some to be trained, he said, “That which is called self is the agent of virtuous and nonvirtuous actions and the experiencer of their results.

original: gdul ba gang dag la las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi byed pa po dang de dag gi 'bras bu zab po dang bcings pa dang thar pa dag ston par byed pa'i bdag ces bya ba de ni 'ga' zhig yod do snyam pa'i lta ba de
analyzed: gdul ba gang dag la las dge ba dang mi dge ba rnams kyi byed pa po dang de dag gi 'bras bu zab po dang bcings pa dang thar pa dag ston par byed pa'i bdag ces bya ba de ni 'ga' zhig yod do snyam pa'i lta ba de
translated: It is that which is bound and liberated.”

original: lta bu byung bar gyur pa de dag gi bdag tu lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lta bu byung bar gyur pa de dag gi bdag tu lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to reverse the view of those who have such a view, he said, “There is a self.”

original: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur ro //
translated: It is also taught that there is no self.

original: gdul ba bzang po gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yongs su smin pa /
analyzed: gdul ba bzang po gang dag dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs yongs su smin pa /
translated: For those disciples who are good vessels for the ultimate teachings, who have fully ripened the accumulations of roots of virtue,

original: srid pa'i chu bo las brgal bar nus pa don dam pa'i gtam gyi snod du gyur pa de dag la ni bdag dang bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan to //
analyzed: srid pa'i chu bo las brgal bar nus pa don dam pa'i gtam gyi snod du gyur pa de dag la ni bdag dang bdag med 'ga' yang med par bstan to //
translated: who are able to cross the river of existence, it is taught that there is no self or non-self at all.

original: yang na gzhan du brtag ste mu stegs byed pa cig 'du byed bdag med pa byed pa byed pa skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i dang can nam dus gzhan du nges par gnas pa rnams la bdag med na /
analyzed: yang na gzhan du brtag ste mu stegs byed pa cig 'du byed bdag med pa byed pa byed pa skad cig ma re re la rnam par 'jig pa'i dang can nam dus gzhan du nges par gnas pa rnams la bdag med na /
translated: Or else, it is imagined otherwise: If the non-self of the aggregates, which are momentary and disintegrate at every moment, or which definitely endure for another time, is imagined to be non-existent,

original: las dang 'bras bu med par brtags nas 'jigs par gyur bdag gis ni bdag go zhes kyang btags par gyur to //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu med par brtags nas 'jigs par gyur bdag gis ni bdag go zhes kyang btags par gyur to //
translated: and if karma and its effects are imagined to be non-existent, one becomes frightened and imagines a self.

original: gzhan gang dag 'di ni lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs tsam du zad de /
analyzed: gzhan gang dag 'di ni lus dang dbang po dang blo'i tshogs tsam du zad de /
translated: Others imagine that this is merely a collection of body, faculties, and mind,

original: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gang rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ni ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
analyzed: 'di la rgyu dang 'bras bu las gang rtogs par 'gyur ba'i bdag ni ngo bo nyid kyis med do //
translated: Here, the self that is to be understood in terms of cause and effect does not exist inherently.

original: sems can du bgrang ba'i 'du byed bdag med pa nges par mi gnas pa gnas su ma byas pa 'di dag la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes bya bar rig nas /
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba'i 'du byed bdag med pa nges par mi gnas pa gnas su ma byas pa 'di dag la yang 'khor ba mi 'thad do zhes bya bar rig nas /
translated: Since it is ascertained that the self is not among the constituents that are counted as sentient beings, and since the self is not a permanent, stable entity, samsara is untenable.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la rmongs pa dag gis ni bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i 'brel pa la rmongs pa dag gis ni bdag med ces kyang bstan par gyur to //
translated: Those who are confused about the relation between cause and effect are taught that there is no self.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mkhyen pa lkog tu ma gyur pa 'jug pa rnams kyis ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das chos thams cad la mkhyen pa lkog tu ma gyur pa 'jug pa rnams kyis ni /
translated: The transcendent buddhas, who have knowledge of all phenomena without exception,

original: bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan to //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag med pa 'ga' yang med par bstan to //
translated: have taught that there is neither a self nor a selflessness.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de la rigs pa gang yin /
analyzed: spros pa ni stong pa nyid kyis 'gag par 'gyur ro zhes gang bshad pa de la rigs pa gang yin /
translated: “You have explained that fabrications cease through emptiness. What is the logic of that?”

original: 'dir bshad pa brjod par bya ba ldog pas te /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa brjod par bya ba ldog pas te /
translated: Here, the response should be stated as follows:🔽“The object of expression is stopped.

original: sgras brjod par bya ba'i don bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa stong pa nyid du mthong bas spros pa dgag par 'gyur te /🔽de la brjod par bya ba la rtogs pas sgro btags pa las ni brjod @71a * //
analyzed: sgras brjod par bya ba'i don bum pa dang snam bu dang shing rta la sogs pa stong pa nyid du mthong bas spros pa dgag par 'gyur te / de la brjod par bya ba la rtogs pas sgro btags pa las ni brjod @71a * //
translated: The meaning expressed, such as a pot, a cloth, a chariot, etc., is seen as emptiness, and conceptual elaborations are thereby stopped.

original: pa'i bdag nyid kyis spros pa dpag tu med par 'byung la dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu mngon sum du byar med pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du byas shing dngos po thams cad
analyzed: pa'i bdag nyid kyis spros pa dpag tu med par 'byung la dngos po thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid rab tu dben pa'i mtshan nyid kyi stong pa nyid nam mkha' lta bu mngon sum du byar med pa'i tshul gyis mngon sum du byas shing dngos po thams cad
translated: In this regard, conceptual elaborations are of the nature of expression, and they occur in an infinite variety due to the superimposition of conceptualization on the object of expression.

original: brjod du med par mthong na /
analyzed: brjod du med par mthong na /
translated: When one sees all things as inexpressible,

original: brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis spros pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa'i bdag nyid kyis spros pa 'gag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: conceptual elaborations of the nature of expression are stopped.

original: brjod par bya ba de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that object of expression stopped?🔽It is said:

original: bshad pa / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
analyzed: bshad pa / sems kyi spyod yul ldog pas so //
translated: By stopping the domain of mind.

original: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mthong bas brjod par bya ba ldog ste /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa ngo bo nyid med pa nyid du mthong bas brjod par bya ba ldog ste /
translated: The domain of mind, such as form, is seen to be devoid of intrinsic reality, and so the expressible is reversed.

original: de yang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang don dam par yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, because it is not ultimately established.

original: de la yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba thob na /
analyzed: de la yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba thob na /
translated: When one attains seeing things as they really are,

original: brjod par bya ba ldog la don dam pa shes pa thob na sems kyi spyod yul ldog go //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ldog la don dam pa shes pa thob na sems kyi spyod yul ldog go //
translated: the expressible is reversed. When one attains the knowledge of the ultimate, the domain of mind is reversed.

original: sems kyi spyod yul de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul de yang ji ltar ldog par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is that domain of mind reversed?🔽It is explained:

original: bshad pa / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
analyzed: bshad pa / ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa //
translated: Unarisen and unceasing,

original: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
analyzed: chos nyid mya ngan 'das dang mtshungs //
translated: the reality of phenomena is like nirvana.

original: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pas sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems kyi spyod yul gzugs la sogs pa dag ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs par rab tu shes pas sems kyi spyod yul ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: The domain of mind, such as form, is well known to be unarisen and unceasing, and the reality of phenomena is like nirvana. Thus, the domain of mind is reversed.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say:

original: don dam par dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa yin na /
analyzed: don dam par dngos po thams cad ma skyes pa dang ma 'gags pa'i chos nyid mya ngan las 'das pa dang mtshungs pa yin na /
translated: In the ultimate, all things are unborn and unceasing, and their reality is the same as nirvana.

original: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bstan pa'i tshul ji lta bu yin /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tha snyad du bstan pa'i tshul ji lta bu yin /
translated: How is it that they are taught in terms of worldly convention?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: thams cad yang dag yang dag min //🔽yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag yang dag min // yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: Everything is real and unreal,🔽Real and not real,

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: Neither unreal nor real.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: That is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: thams cad yang dag ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams tha snyad kyi bden pa dang mi 'gal bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad yang dag ces bya ba ni mig la sogs pa skye mched rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams tha snyad kyi bden pa dang mi 'gal bar yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Everything is real means that the sense spheres such as the eyes and so on and the objects such as form and so on exist without contradicting conventional truth.

original: yang dag min zhes bya ba ni don dam par brten nas byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag min zhes bya ba ni don dam par brten nas byung ba sgyu ma bzhin du ngo bo nyid yongs su ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar snang ba de ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Unreal means that ultimately they are like illusions, because their nature is not established as real, and they do not exist as they appear.

original: yang dag yang ma yin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag yang ma yin nyid //
translated: Real and not real

original: ces bya ni /
analyzed: ces bya ni /
translated: means that

original: bden pa gnyi ga'i rnam bal ltos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa gnyi ga'i rnam bal ltos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is dependent on the two realities.

original: yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: It is not unreal, nor is it real.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is because

original: mngon par @71b rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par @71b rtogs pa'i dus na rnal 'byor pa rnam pa thams cad du chos thams cad kyi de kho na la rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: at the time of realization, the yogi/ni is non-conceptual with regard to the reality of all phenomena in every way.

original: yang na thams cad la yang dag ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang na thams cad la yang dag ces bya ba ni /
translated: Or, “real” means

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang pa'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa shes byar bstan pa dag yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spang pa'i phyir nang dang phyi rol gyi skye mched bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid g-yo ba med pa shes byar bstan pa dag yin no //
translated: the Blessed One taught the internal and external sense-spheres as objects of knowledge, which are devoid of self and “mine” and are unmoving, in order to abandon the afflictive obstructions.

original: yang dag min zhes bya ba ni rnam bar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gis bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang bdag gi yin pa'i phyir byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom par byed pa dag yin no //
analyzed: yang dag min zhes bya ba ni rnam bar shes pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdag gis bdag dang bcas pa'i phyir dang bdag gi yin pa'i phyir byed pa por brjod pas nyan pa dang sems pa dang sgom par byed pa dag yin no //
translated: “Unreal” means the sense-spheres of the ear, etc., which are described as the agent of hearing, etc., because they are associated with the self that is characterized by consciousness and are “mine.”

original: yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
analyzed: yang dag yang dag ma yin nyid //
translated: It is real and unreal.

original: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos kyi tha snyad la ltos pa dag yin no //🔽yang dag min min yang dag min //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni 'jig rten dang bstan bcos kyi tha snyad la ltos pa dag yin no // yang dag min min yang dag min //
translated: These are dependent on mundane and philosophical conventions.

original: zhes bya ba ste /🔽don dam pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul nyid du 'gyur ba dngos po'i tshul gyis yang dag ba ma yin pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste / don dam pa'i tshul gyis chos thams cad skye ba med pa'i phyir shes pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rnam par rtog pa med pa'i spyod yul nyid du 'gyur ba dngos po'i tshul gyis yang dag ba ma yin pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa
translated: They are not unreal, nor are they real.

original: dang yang dag pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de lta bu med pa yin no //
analyzed: dang yang dag pa nyid du rnam par brtags pa gang yin pa de lta bu med pa yin no //
translated: This is because, in the manner of ultimate truth, all things are non-arisen, and therefore, in the manner of things as they are, the domain of conceptual and non-conceptual cognition is not unreal, nor is it real.

original: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba ni rim pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sems can gyi don yang dag par thob par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o // zhes bya ba ni rim pa rnam pa bzhi po de dag gis sems can gyi don yang dag par thob par bya ba'i phyir bstan pa 'jug pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ste /
translated: This is the teaching of the Lord Buddha, because it is the teaching that is engaged in order to properly achieve the aims of sentient beings by means of these four modes.

original: 'dis slob ma'i tshogs rnam pa mang po dag la dbang po dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang dus kyi dbang gis mtho ris dang byad grol gyi lam phyin ci ma log par rjes su ston pas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'dis slob ma'i tshogs rnam pa mang po dag la dbang po dang bsam pa dang bag la nyal dang dus kyi dbang gis mtho ris dang byad grol gyi lam phyin ci ma log par rjes su ston pas bstan pa'o //
translated: This teaches the many kinds of disciples, by means of their faculties, thoughts, latent propensities, and times, the unerring paths to heaven and liberation.

original: 'dir smras pa de kho na'i mtshan nyid gang yin /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa de kho na'i mtshan nyid gang yin /
translated: Here someone asks, What is the characteristic of reality?

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here the answer is:🔽Not known from elsewhere, peaceful,

original: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhi ba dang // spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa //
translated: not fabricated by mental fabrications,

original: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
analyzed: rnam rtog med don tha dad min //
translated: without conceptualization, not different,

original: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de ni de nyid mtshan nyid do //
translated: that is the characteristic of reality.

original: gzhan las shes min zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan las shes pa med pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan las shes min zhes bya ba ni 'di la gzhan las shes pa med pa ste /
translated: Not known from elsewhere means that it is not known from elsewhere,

original: lung med par bdag gi mngon sum du 'gyur zhing bdag nyid kyis rang rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lung med par bdag gi mngon sum du 'gyur zhing bdag nyid kyis rang rig par bya ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that it is not known from another, that it is not known from scripture, that it is known by oneself, that it is known by one’s own direct perception, that it is known by oneself, that it is self-knowing.

original: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhi ba zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid dang bral ba'i phyir te /
translated: Peaceful means free from intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi yul la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma @72a * //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid dang khyad par gyi yul la rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul ma @72a * //
translated: The domain of conceptual thought is the nature and attributes of things.🔽

original: yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not the domain of conceptual activity with regard to the own-being and the special qualities of things.

original: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is said to be “unfabricated by mental fabrications”

original: mngon par brjod pa mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa mtshan nyid kyi spros pa nye bar zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the pacification of the mental fabrications of verbal expression.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba med pa nyid kyis 'di dang 'di'o zhes rnam par ma brtags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba med pa nyid kyis 'di dang 'di'o zhes rnam par ma brtags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said to be “non-conceptual” because it is not conceptually differentiated as this or that by the absence of appearances.

original: don tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid ro gcig pa'i phyir don dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni chos nyid ro gcig pa'i phyir don dbyer med pa'o //
translated: It is said to be “without a separate meaning” because it is indivisible, since it has the one taste of reality.

original: yang na gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa med pa de'i phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa'o //
translated: Or else, because it is non-conceptual, therefore it is unfabricated by mental fabrications.

original: gang gi phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa de'i phyir zhi ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir spros pa rnams kyis ma spros pa de'i phyir zhi ba'o //
translated: Because it is unfabricated by mental fabrications, therefore it is peaceful.

original: gang gi phyir zhi ba de'i phyir don tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhi ba de'i phyir don tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it is peaceful, therefore it is without a separate meaning.

original: gang gi phyir don tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtogs pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan las shes pa ma yin no zhes rnam grangs kyi sgrar bstan te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir don tha dad pa ma yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtogs pa med pa de'i phyir gzhan las shes pa ma yin no zhes rnam grangs kyi sgrar bstan te /
translated: Because the object is not different, therefore there is no conception, and therefore consciousness does not arise from another. This is indicated by the term “alternative.”🔽

original: de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni de kho na'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: Since it is not a different object, therefore it is not a different consciousness. Since it is not a different consciousness, therefore it is not known by another. This is the definition of reality.

original: 'di yang de kho na'i mtshan nyid gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang de kho na'i mtshan nyid gzhan yin te /
translated: This is another definition of reality.

original: gang la brten nas gang 'byung ba //
analyzed: gang la brten nas gang 'byung ba //
translated: Whatever arises in dependence on something

original: de ni re zhig de nyid min //🔽de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
analyzed: de ni re zhig de nyid min // de las gzhan pa'ang ma yin phyir //
translated: is not that, nor is it different.

original: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir chad min rtag ma yin //
translated: Therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: 'di ltar gang la brten te gang byung ba de min zhig de nyid kyang ma yin la /🔽de las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir tshad pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la brten te gang byung ba de min zhig de nyid kyang ma yin la / de las gzhan pa yang ma yin pa'i phyir tshad pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Thus, whatever arises in dependence on something is not that, nor is it different.

original: rtag pa yang ma yin te brtag pa 'dis don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin pa bstan to //
analyzed: rtag pa yang ma yin te brtag pa 'dis don gcig pa ma yin pa dang / don tha dad pa ma yin pa dang / chad pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa ma yin pa bstan to //
translated: Therefore it is neither annihilated nor eternal. This analysis shows that it is neither the same nor different, neither annihilated nor eternal.

original: don gcig min don tha dad min //
analyzed: don gcig min don tha dad min //
translated: It is neither the same nor different.

original: chad pa ma yin rtag min pa //🔽de ni sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi //
analyzed: chad pa ma yin rtag min pa // de ni sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi //
translated: It is neither annihilation nor eternalism.🔽This is the nectar-like teaching

original: mgon po'i bstan pa bdud rtsi yin //
analyzed: mgon po'i bstan pa bdud rtsi yin //
translated: of the Buddha, the protector of the world.

original: de ltar na mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rnam par 'byed pa don gcig pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: de ltar na mtho ris dang byang grol gyi lam rnam par 'byed pa don gcig pa ma yin pa /
translated: Thus, the distinction of the path to the higher realms and liberation is not the same,

original: don tha dad pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: don tha dad pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not different,

original: chad pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: chad pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not annihilation,

original: rtag pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rtag pa ma yin pa /
translated: it is not eternalism,

original: mchog tu zab pa don dam pa'i de kho na gsal bar byed pa de ni /
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa don dam pa'i de kho na gsal bar byed pa de ni /
translated: it illuminates the ultimate reality, which is supremely profound.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i bstan pa dus rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das 'jig rten gyi mgon po'i bstan pa dus rtsi'i go 'phang 'thob pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: This is the cause for attaining the state of nectar, the teaching of the Buddha, the Bhagavān, the protector of the world.

original: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
analyzed: rdzogs sangs rgyas rnams ma byung zhing //
translated: Even when the perfect buddhas have not appeared

original: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni zad gyur kyang //
translated: and the śrāvakas have ceased to exist,

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes ni //
translated: the wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas

original: brten pa med las rab tu skye //
analyzed: brten pa med las rab tu skye //
translated: arises fully from the absence of dependence.

original: nyan thos gang 'di la goms par ma byas pa rnams la /
analyzed: nyan thos gang 'di la goms par ma byas pa rnams la /
translated: For those śrāvakas who have not cultivated familiarity with this,

original: brgyal rdzogs pa'i sangs @72b rgyas rnams ma byung ngam /
analyzed: brgyal rdzogs pa'i sangs @72b rgyas rnams ma byung ngam /
translated: even when the perfect buddhas have not appeared

original: nyan thos rnams zad par gyur te /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams zad par gyur te /
translated: and the śrāvakas have ceased to exist,

original: rkyen dang mi ldan du zin na yang de dag gi sngon goms pa'i rgyu las byung ba rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa brten pa med pa tsam gyi rkyen las rab tu skyes bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen dang mi ldan du zin na yang de dag gi sngon goms pa'i rgyu las byung ba rang sangs rgyas kyi ye shes gzhan las shes pa ma yin pa brten pa med pa tsam gyi rkyen las rab tu skyes bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they do not have the conditions, the transcendent wisdom of the pratyekabuddhas arises from the causes of their previous training, from the conditions of mere nonreliance, and not from other conditions.

original: de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni bsgrub pa rnams la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas bdag la legs par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsam pa thag pas de bsgrubs par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstan pa bdud rtsi de ni bsgrub pa rnams la tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma dag la bdud rtsi'i go 'phang thob par byed pa yin pas bdag la legs par 'dod pa rnams kyi bsam pa thag pas de bsgrubs par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, since this nectar-like teaching causes those who practice it to attain the state of nectar in this life and the next, those who desire what is best for themselves should practice it with a sincere mind.

original: bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: bdag dang chos brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the examination of the self and phenomena,

original: rab tu byad pa bco brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: rab tu byad pa bco brgyad pa'o /
translated: the eighteenth chapter.

original: // /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: // /'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: dus ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dus ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Time exists,

original: de yang ltos pa can du 'grub ste /🔽da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni 'das pa la ltos pa /
analyzed: de yang ltos pa can du 'grub ste / da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni 'das pa la ltos pa /
translated: and it is established as dependent.🔽The present and the future depend on the past.

original: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni da ltar la ltos la /
analyzed: 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa dag ni da ltar la ltos la /
translated: The past and the future depend on the present.

original: da ltar dang 'das pa dag ni ma 'ongs pa la ltos te 'grub po //
analyzed: da ltar dang 'das pa dag ni ma 'ongs pa la ltos te 'grub po //
translated: The present and the past are established in reliance on the future.

original: de bzhin du mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring la sogs pa dang / gcig la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang rim pa 'di nyid kyis yod par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring la sogs pa dang / gcig la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams kyang rim pa 'di nyid kyis yod par shes par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, one should understand that the existence of things such as the highest, the lowest, the middling, and so on, and things such as one, and so on, are established in this very order.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and the future

original: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'das la ltos gyur na //
translated: If they exist in reliance on the past,

original: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: The present and the future

original: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur /
translated: Would exist in the past.

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag gal te 'das pa'i dus la ltos nas yod par gyur na /
translated: If the present and future exist in reliance on the past,

original: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa'i dus na yod par 'gyur te /
translated: then the present and future would exist in the past.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar de gnyis de na yod na ltos su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de gnyis de na yod na ltos su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if they exist in the past, it is suitable that they rely on it.

original: de yang mi 'thad pas de'i phyir de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa la ltos nas 'grub po //
analyzed: de yang mi 'thad pas de'i phyir de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus dag 'das pa la ltos nas 'grub po //
translated: But that is unacceptable, and therefore the past is established in reliance on the future and present.🔽

original: zhes gang smra spa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes gang smra spa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But that is untenable. Therefore, it is illogical to state, “The present and future are established in reliance on the past.”

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:🔽If the present and future

original: de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus de na yod pa ma yin te /🔽'o na ji zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa'i dus de na yod pa ma yin te / 'o na ji zhe na /
translated: did not exist in the past,🔽then how could the present and future

original: de la ltos nas 'grub pa yin no //🔽'dir bshad pa /🔽da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: de la ltos nas 'grub pa yin no // 'dir bshad pa / da ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: rely on the past?

original: gal te de na med gyur na //🔽de ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
analyzed: gal te de na med gyur na // de ltar byung dang ma 'ongs pa //
translated: If the present and future did not exist in the past,

original: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur //
translated: then how could the present and future rely on the past?🔽If the present and future

original: de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur la /🔽da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs @73a * //
analyzed: de ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag gal te 'das pa'i dus de na med par gyur la / da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs @73a * //
translated: did not exist in the past,🔽then how could the present and future

original: pa'i dus de na med pa de dag ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: pa'i dus de na med pa de dag ji ltar de la ltos par 'gyur te /🔽ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: rely on the past?

original: 'di ltar gsum car yang tshogs par gyur na ltos pa 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsum car yang tshogs par gyur na ltos pa 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is tenable that the three rely on each other.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa la ma ltos pa kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa dag 'das pa la ma ltos pa kho nar 'grub par 'gyur ro /
translated: The present and future are established without relying on the past.

original: 'dir bshad pa //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: 'das pa la ni ma ltos par //
analyzed: 'das pa la ni ma ltos par //
translated: Without relying on the past,

original: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: de gnyis 'grub pa yod ma yin //
translated: Those two are not established.

original: 'das pa'i dus la yod par ma ltos par yang de ltar byung pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de gnyis rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus la yod par ma ltos par yang de ltar byung pa dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus de gnyis rang las rab tu 'grub pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Without relying on the existence of the past, those two, the present and the future, are not established on their own.

original: de phyir da ltar byung ba dang // ma 'ong dus /
analyzed: de phyir da ltar byung ba dang // ma 'ong dus /
translated: Therefore, the present and the future

original: kyang yod ma yin //🔽de ltar gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: kyang yod ma yin // de ltar gang gi phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa gnyis 'das pa'i dus na yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Do not exist.🔽Because the present and the future do not exist in the past,

original: ltos par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: ltos par mi 'thad la /
translated: it is untenable that they rely on the past.

original: 'das pa lam ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa lam ltos par yang de gnyis 'grub pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir da ltar byung ba dang ma 'ongs pa'i dus kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The past and future are not established in dependence on the present, nor is the present established in dependence on the past and future. Therefore the present and future times do not exist.

original: rim pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid kyis //🔽lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang // mchog dang tha ma 'brid la sogs //
analyzed: rim pa'i tshul ni 'di nyid kyis // lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang // mchog dang tha ma 'brid la sogs //
translated: By this very method of argument,🔽the other two times should be understood,

original: gcig la sogs pa'ang shes par bya //
analyzed: gcig la sogs pa'ang shes par bya //
translated: as well as the rest, such as the combined,🔽the best, the worst, and the middling.

original: rim pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyis dus lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring la sogs pa dang gcig dang gnyis dang mang po la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rim pa'i tshul 'di nyid kyis dus lhag ma gnyis po bsnor ba dang mchog dang tha ma dang 'bring la sogs pa dang gcig dang gnyis dang mang po la sogs pa dag kyang shes par bya'o //
translated: By this very method of argument, the other two times should be understood, as well as the rest, such as the combined, the best, the worst, the middling, one, two, many, and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: dus ni ma ltos par yang yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: dus ni ma ltos par yang yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Time exists without depending on anything else,

original: skad cig dang thad cig dang yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang dus tshigs dang nur ba dang lo la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig dang thad cig dang yud tsam dang / mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang zla ba phyed dang / zla ba dang dus tshigs dang nur ba dang lo la sogs pa'i tshad dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is measured in terms of instants, moments, periods, nights, days, fortnights, months, seasons, transits, years, and so on.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, it is said:

original: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
analyzed: mi gnas dus su 'dzin mi byed //
translated: It is not apprehended at the time it endures.

original: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //
analyzed: gang zhig gzung bar bya ba'i dus //
translated: What is there to be apprehended at the time

original: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
analyzed: gnas pa yod pa ma yin pas //
translated: That is not enduring?

original: ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: ma bzung dus su ji ltar gdags //
translated: How can time be designated when it is not apprehended?

original: dngos po mi gnas pa la ni su yang dus su 'dzin par mi byed la dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis dus de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba'i chos gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po mi gnas pa la ni su yang dus su 'dzin par mi byed la dngos po las gzhan pa gang zhig gang gis dus de'i ngo bo nyid du gzung bar bya ba'i chos gnas pa yang yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: No one apprehends a nonenduring thing as time. And since there is no other thing that is the basis of the designation of time, there is no enduring phenomenon that is apprehended as the essence of time.

original: ma bzung ba dus su ji ltar gdags te /
analyzed: ma bzung ba dus su ji ltar gdags te /
translated: How can time be designated when it is not apprehended?

original: de'i phyir dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dus zhes bya ba dngos po 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that anything called “time” exists.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dus ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Objection:

original: snga ma dang phyi ma dang cig car @73b ma yin pa dang / yun ring po dang myur ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rtags yod pa'i phyir ro //

original: gal te dus dngos po la brtan pa yin na /

analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: yod pa la skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: med pa skye ba mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: tshogs la gzhung du yod rigs na /
translated: it would be logical that it would be apprehended in the assembly.

original: tshogs pa nyid la gzung du med /
analyzed: tshogs pa nyid la gzung du med /

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /

analyzed: gal te rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyi //

original: 'dir smras pa /

translated: The cause ceases after it has given rise to the effect. Therefore, although the effect does not exist in the assembly of causes and conditions, the effect does possess a cause, and the error stated previously does not arise.

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te rgyus ni 'bras bu la //

analyzed: / zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te tshogs dang lhan cig tu //

analyzed: 'bras bu yang ni skye 'gyur na // skyed pa dang ni gang bskyed pa //
translated: Together with the assembly,🔽Then that which gives rise

analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu tshogs pa nyid dang lhan cig skye'o zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that the effect arises simultaneously with the assemblage itself.

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

analyzed: 'bras bu skyes par gyur na ni //

analyzed: skyon chen por thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is unacceptable because it would follow that there would be a great error.

analyzed: de'i phyir 'bras bu tshogs pa nyid kyi snga rol na yod do zhes bya ba de rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / 'gags pa nub par gyur pa yis // 'bras bu skyes pa ji ltar skyed //

analyzed: rgyu 'gags pa nub par gyur pas 'bras bu skyes pa rigs pa gang gis skyes par 'gyur /

analyzed: 'bras bu dang 'brel pa'i rgyu gnas pas kyang rigs pa gang gis 'bras bu skyed par 'gyur /

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /

analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dang ma 'brel ba des 'bras bu skyed par byed do //

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /

original: ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //
analyzed: ci ste de 'bras ma 'brel na //

analyzed: 'bras bu gang zhig skyed par byed //

analyzed: gang rgyun tu 'jig cing nyi ma re re'i skad cig skad cig la zad cing 'bral bar 'gyur ba de ni zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is momentary disintegration and is exhausted and separated in each instant of every day is called “exhausted.”

original: chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du nges par mi gnas pa ngo bo nyid mngon par ma thob pa de la 'byung ba brtag par mi nus pas /
analyzed: chu bo'i rgyun bzhin du nges par mi gnas pa ngo bo nyid mngon par ma thob pa de la 'byung ba brtag par mi nus pas /
translated: Since that which is not definitely enduring like the flow of a river and does not obtain an intrinsic reality cannot be conceived as arising,

original: de'i phyir zad pa la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zad pa la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: therefore arising does not exist for that which is exhausted.

original: gang brtag pa rnam par mi 'gyur ba gtan du zad par mi 'gyur zhing 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba de ni ma zad pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: gang brtag pa rnam par mi 'gyur ba gtan du zad par mi 'gyur zhing 'bral bar mi 'gyur ba de ni ma zad pa zhes bya ste /
translated: That which is not transformed by analysis, which is never exhausted, and which is never separated from that is called “inexhaustible.”

original: brtag pa rnam pa de dang des nges par gnas pa mi ldog pa de la 'byung ba brtag par mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: brtag pa rnam pa de dang des nges par gnas pa mi ldog pa de la 'byung ba brtag par mi 'thad pas /
translated: Since it definitely abides in that way, it is not reversed. It is not tenable that that which definitely abides and is not reversed arises.

original: de'i phyir ma zad pa la yang 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ma zad pa la yang 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore arising does not exist for the inexhaustible.

original: zad pa gang la 'byung ba med pa de la 'jig pa mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: zad pa gang la 'byung ba med pa de la 'jig pa mi 'thad pas /
translated: Since arising does not exist for that which is exhausted, destruction is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir zad pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zad pa la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore destruction does not exist for that which is exhausted.

original: ma zad pa gang la 'byung ba mi 'thad pa de la yang 'jig pa mi 'thad pas /
analyzed: ma zad pa gang la 'byung ba mi 'thad pa de la yang 'jig pa mi 'thad pas /
translated: Since arising is not tenable for that which is inexhaustible, destruction is not tenable.

original: de'i phyir mi zad pa la yang 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir mi zad pa la yang 'byung ba med do //
translated: Therefore arising does not exist for that which is inexhaustible.

original: de ltar dngos po gang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na /🔽zad pa'i ngang can yin pa de la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa dang / ji ste skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na //
analyzed: de ltar dngos po gang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na / zad pa'i ngang can yin pa de la 'byung ba yod pa ma yin pa dang / ji ste skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na //
translated: Thus, if things have the nature of destruction,🔽then arising does not exist for that which has the nature of exhaustion.🔽If it does not disintegrate immediately after it has arisen,

original: zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas //
analyzed: zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas //
translated: then it does not have the nature of exhaustion.

original: de la yang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de la yang 'byung ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Moreover, emergence does not exist for that which is destroyed.

original: de bzhin du dngos po gang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po gang 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin na /
translated: In the same way, if a thing has the nature of destruction,🔽since it has the nature of cessation, destruction does not exist for it.

original: zad pa'i ngang can yin pas de la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / ci ste skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas /
analyzed: zad pa'i ngang can yin pas de la 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa dang / ci ste skyes ma thag tu mi 'jig na zad pa'i ngang can ma yin pas /
translated: But if it does not disintegrate immediately after it has arisen, since it does not have the nature of cessation,

original: de la yang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de la yang 'jig pa yod pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: destruction does not exist for it.

original: dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: dngos po ni 'jig pa'i bdag nyid can yin yang skyes ma thag tu 'jig par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, although a thing has the nature of destruction, it does not disintegrate immediately after it has arisen.

original: 'di ltar skyes @79a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes @79a * //
translated: In this regard, immediately after it has arisen,

original: ma thag tu gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur bas /🔽de'i phyir 'jig pa ni 'byung ba med par yod la /
analyzed: ma thag tu gnas pa 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de'i 'og tu 'jig par 'gyur bas / de'i phyir 'jig pa ni 'byung ba med par yod la /
translated: endurance arises and after that it disintegrates.

original: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par yod do zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin na //
analyzed: 'byung ba yang 'jig pa med par yod do zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin na //
translated: Therefore, it is illogical to say that destruction exists without emergence and emergence exists without destruction.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni 'jig pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni 'jig pa kho na yin te /
translated: Emergence and destruction exist only in things,

original: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are properties of things.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa med par ni //
translated: Without emergence and destruction,

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: an existent thing does not exist.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med par ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med par ni dngos po yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Without emergence and destruction, an existent thing does not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa de ni rtag pa'am med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag med pa de ni rtag pa'am med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because that which lacks emergence and destruction would be permanent or nonexistent.

original: de la rtag pa ni 'jig rten na 'ga' yang med la /
analyzed: de la rtag pa ni 'jig rten na 'ga' yang med la /
translated: In the world, nothing is permanent.

original: med pa nyid yin na ni de dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: med pa nyid yin na ni de dngos po yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is nonexistent, it is not an existent thing.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par //
translated: Without an existent thing,

original: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: 'byung dang 'jig pa yod ma yin //
translated: Emergence and destruction do not exist.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin par 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Without an existent thing, emergence and destruction do not exist.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po med na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if a thing does not exist, emergence and destruction would be groundless.

original: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, emergence and destruction exist.

original: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is illogical to say that because it is an existent thing.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:🔽Emergence and destruction

original: stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: stong la 'byung dang 'jig pa dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: are not tenable with respect to the empty.🔽Emergence and destruction

original: mi stong pa la'ang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi stong pa la'ang 'byung 'jig dag /'thad pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: are not tenable with respect to the nonempty.

original: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa nyid du gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa nyid du gyur na /
translated: If emergence and destruction exist,

original: de dag dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa'am mi stong pa la yod par 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: de dag dngos po ngo bo nyid stong pa'am mi stong pa la yod par 'gyur grang na /
translated: then they would exist with respect to an existent thing.

original: de la re zhig dngos po yod par gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos po yod par gyur pa ma yin pa ngo bo nyid stong pa la ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But emergence and destruction do not exist with respect to an existent thing that is empty of an intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽ngo bo nyid stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / ngo bo nyid stong pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is this?🔽Because emergence and destruction are untenable with respect to that which is empty of an intrinsic reality.

original: dngos po yod par gyur pa ngo bo nyid mi stong pa la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po yod par gyur pa ngo bo nyid mi stong pa la yang 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: Also, emergence and destruction do not exist with respect to an existent thing that is not empty of an intrinsic reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong pa nges par gnas pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis mi stong pa nges par gnas pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa la 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that that which definitely endures without changing into something else, and is not empty of its own entity, arises and is destroyed.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:🔽It is untenable that emergence and destruction

original: 'byung ba dag ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi @79b 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni 'jig pa dag / gcig pa nyid du mi @79b 'thad do //
translated: are the same.🔽It is also untenable that emergence and destruction

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad do //
translated: are different.

original: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag yod par gyur na /
translated: In this regard, if emergence and destruction exist,

original: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /🔽re zhig gcig pa nyid du ni mi 'thad de /
analyzed: gcig pa nyid dam gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na / re zhig gcig pa nyid du ni mi 'thad de /
translated: they would be the same or different.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na shes pa dang mi shes pa dag bzhin no //🔽gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyir dper na shes pa dang mi shes pa dag bzhin no // gzhan nyid du yang mi 'thad de /
translated: First, it is untenable that they are the same because they are incompatible, like, for example, consciousness and ignorance.

original: dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir dper na gang yang rung ba'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la brten pa'i phyir dper na gang yang rung ba'i bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is also untenable that they are different because they depend on the same thing, like, for example, the nature of any one thing.

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / mthong ngo snyam du khyod sems na //
translated: You think, “I see emergence and destruction.”

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa dag / gti mug nyid kyis mthong ba yin //
translated: Arising and destruction are seen Due to delusion itself.

original: ji ste brgya la khyod 'di snyam du dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mngon sum nyid du mthong bas de las 'thad pa gzhan ci dgos snyam du sems na /
analyzed: ji ste brgya la khyod 'di snyam du dngos po rnams kyi 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag mngon sum nyid du mthong bas de las 'thad pa gzhan ci dgos snyam du sems na /
translated: But if you think, “Since the arising and destruction of things are seen by direct perception, what other tenability is needed?”

original: de la bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la bshad par bya ste /
translated: Then Nāgārjuna addresses this point:

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni gti mug can mi shes pa phyin ci log dang ldan pas mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag ni gti mug can mi shes pa phyin ci log dang ldan pas mthong ba yin te /
translated: Arising and destruction are seen by those who are deluded, who possess ignorance and misconception.

original: gang phyin ci log dang ldan pas mthong ba de ni don dam par mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gang phyin ci log dang ldan pas mthong ba de ni don dam par mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: That which is seen by those who possess misconception is not ultimately seen.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: dngos po dngos las mi skye ste //🔽dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos po dngos las mi skye ste // dngos med dngos las mi skye'o //
translated: A thing does not arise from a thing.🔽A nonthing does not arise from a thing.

original: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po dngos med mi skye ste //
translated: A thing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: dngos med dngos med mi skye'o //
analyzed: dngos med dngos med mi skye'o //
translated: A nonthing does not arise from a nonthing.

original: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dngos po la brten pa zhig yod par rtog na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dngos po la brten pa zhig yod par rtog na /
translated: Here if you imagine that arising and destruction exist in dependence on things,

original: de la dngos po dngos po las skye ba'am /
analyzed: de la dngos po dngos po las skye ba'am /
translated: then either a thing would arise from a thing

original: dngos po med pa dngos po las skye ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po las skye ba'am /
translated: An entity does not arise from an entity,🔽nor does a nonentity arise from a nonentity.

original: dngos po dngos po med pa las skye ba'am /
analyzed: dngos po dngos po med pa las skye ba'am /
translated: Nor does an entity arise from a nonentity,

original: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dngos po med pa las skye bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: nor does a nonentity arise from an entity.

original: de la re zhig dngos po ni dngos po las mi skye ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig dngos po ni dngos po las mi skye ste /
translated: First, an entity does not arise from an entity,

original: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngos po yin pa'i phyir dper na skyes pa bzhin no //
translated: because it is an entity, like that which has arisen.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po las mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po las mi skye ste /
translated: Nor does a nonentity arise from an entity,

original: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: skye ba'i snga rol na med pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because it does not exist prior to arising,

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir dper na de las gzhan pa bzhin no //
translated: or because it is inexpressible, like something else.

original: dngos po ni dngos po med pa las mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po ni dngos po med pa las mi skye ste /
translated: Nor does an entity arise from a nonentity,

original: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: phyogs gnyi gar bstan pa'i phyir ram /
translated: because both positions have been refuted,

original: rgyu med pa las byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las byung bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or because it would follow that it would arise without a cause.

original: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa las mi skye ste /
analyzed: dngos po med pa yang dngos po med pa las mi skye ste /
translated: Nor does a nonentity arise from a nonentity,

original: rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa dang grags pa'i gnod pas gnod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is undermined by inference and what is commonly acknowledged.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du dngos po skye ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig @80a * //🔽pa dag dngos po la brten par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rnam pa thams cad du dngos po skye ba mi 'thad pa de'i phyir 'byung ba dang 'jig @80a * // pa dag dngos po la brten par mi 'thad do //
translated: Because in every way the arising of things is untenable, therefore arising and destruction are untenable in things.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
analyzed: dngos po bdag las mi skye ste //
translated: Things do not arise from themselves,

original: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
analyzed: gzhan las skye ba nyid ma yin //
translated: Nor do they arise from another.

original: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan las skye ba ni //
translated: Arising from both is also impossible.

original: yod min ji ltar skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: yod min ji ltar skye bar 'gyur //
translated: How could they arise without a cause?

original: 'di la gal te dngos po skye bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te dngos po skye bar 'gyur na /
translated: If things arise,

original: de bdag las sam /
analyzed: de bdag las sam /
translated: do they arise from themselves,

original: gzhan las sam /
analyzed: gzhan las sam /
translated: from another,

original: gnyis ka las skye bar 'gyur grang na /🔽de la re zhig dngos po ni bdag las skye ba med de /
analyzed: gnyis ka las skye bar 'gyur grang na / de la re zhig dngos po ni bdag las skye ba med de /
translated: or from both?

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod la yang skye bar brtag pa don med du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyis yod la yang skye bar brtag pa don med du 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / thug pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: First, things do not arise from themselves because it is pointless to conceive that what already exists by way of its own nature arises again, and because it follows that arising would be endless.

original: dngos po ni gzhan las kyang skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po ni gzhan las kyang skye ba med de /
translated: Things also do not arise from another because it is pointless to conceive that what does not exist by way of its own nature arises from another.

original: dngos po ma skyes shing med pa las gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po ma skyes shing med pa las gzhan mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is untenable that a non-arisen, non-existent thing is different from those.

original: dngos po ni bdag dang gzhan las skye ba med de /
analyzed: dngos po ni bdag dang gzhan las skye ba med de /
translated: A thing does not arise from itself or from another,

original: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i skyon de gnyi gar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the previously mentioned errors would ensue for both.

original: de ltar dngos po gang bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba med pa de /
analyzed: de ltar dngos po gang bdag dang gzhan dang gnyi ga las skye ba med pa de /
translated: Thus, a thing that does not arise from itself, from another, or from both

original: de rnam pa gzhan gang las ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de rnam pa gzhan gang las ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: how could it arise from any other way?

original: de lta bas na dngos po skye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po skye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the arising of a thing is untenable.

original: dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: dngos po yod pa ma yin na /
translated: If a thing does not exist,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhi med pas yod par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa dag gzhi med pas yod par mi 'thad do //
translated: then emergence and destruction would be groundless, and thus it is untenable that they exist.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
translated: if one asserts that a thing exists,

original: rtag dang chad par lta bar ni//
analyzed: rtag dang chad par lta bar ni//
translated: then the views of eternalism and nihilism

original: thal bar 'gyur te dngos de ni //
analyzed: thal bar 'gyur te dngos de ni //
translated: would follow, because that thing

original: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs na //
translated: If one asserts that a thing exists,

original: rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the views of eternalism and nihilism would follow.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po de ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po de ni rtag pa dang mi rtag par 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because that thing would be both permanent and impermanent.

original: de la re zhig gal te dngos po de rtag na ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la re zhig gal te dngos po de rtag na ni mi 'jig pa'i phyir rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur la /
translated: If that thing is permanent, then it follows it would be the view of permanence because it would not disintegrate.

original: mi rtag na ni 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: mi rtag na ni 'jig pa'i phyir chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If it is impermanent, then it follows it would be the view of annihilation because it would disintegrate.

original: de yang mi 'dod de skyon che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod de skyon che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is unacceptable because it has great faults.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
analyzed: dngos po yod par khas blangs kyang //
translated: Even though you accept that things exist,

original: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
analyzed: chad par mi 'gyur rtag mi 'gyur //
translated: it is not annihilation and it is not permanence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar / 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun do srid pa yin phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar / 'bras bu rgyu yi 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun do srid pa yin phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of the arising and disintegration of effects and causes is existence.

original: de la rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir chad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la rgyu 'gag bzhin pa las 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir chad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: In that regard, because the effect arises from the cause that is in the process of ceasing, it is not annihilation.

original: 'bras bu skyes pa na rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyes pa na rgyu 'gag pa'i phyir rtag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the effect arises when the cause ceases, it is not permanence.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa @80b yin gyur na //
analyzed: gal te 'bras rgyu'i 'byung 'jig gi / rgyun de srid pa @80b yin gyur na //
translated: If the continuum of the arising and disintegration of effects and causes were existence,

original: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'jig la yang skye med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because that which is destroyed does not arise again,

original: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: rgyu ni chad par thal bar 'gyur //
translated: The consequence of the annihilation of causes would follow.

original: gal te 'bras bu dang rgyu ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun ni gang yin pa de srid pa yin par 'gyur na /
