analyzed: gal te 'bras bu dang rgyu ni 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i rgyun ni gang yin pa de srid pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If becoming were the continuum of the arising and destruction of effects and causes,

original: de lta na 'jig pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na 'jig pa la yang skye ba med pa'i phyir rgyun chad pa thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then because that which is destroyed does not arise again, the consequence of the annihilation of the continuum would follow.

original: dper na sa bon tshig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon tshig pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it would be like a burnt seed.

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover,

original: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
analyzed: dngos po ngo bo nyid yod na //
translated: If things existed through their own intrinsic reality,

original: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: dngos med 'gyur bar mi rigs so //
translated: It would not be tenable that they become nonthings.

original: bum pa'i dngos po bum pa ngo bo nyid kyis yod na /
analyzed: bum pa'i dngos po bum pa ngo bo nyid kyis yod na /
translated: If the thing that is a pot existed through its own intrinsic reality,

original: dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
analyzed: dngos po med par 'gyur bar mi rigs te /
translated: it would not be tenable that it becomes a nonthing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: ngo bo nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gzhan du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an intrinsic reality does not change into something else.

original: de lta bas na dngos por lta ba yod na /🔽rgyu yang 'gag par mi 'thad la /
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos por lta ba yod na / rgyu yang 'gag par mi 'thad la /
translated: Thus, if the view of things exists,🔽it is not tenable that causes cease

original: 'bras bu yang skye bar mi 'thad de skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu yang skye bar mi 'thad de skye ba dang 'gag pa dag ni 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and it is not tenable that effects arise, because arising and cessation are changes.

original: de lta na yang de la rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de lta na yang de la rtag par lta bar thal bar 'gyur bas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But it is not maintained that it is a view of permanence.

original: yang gzhan yang /🔽mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
analyzed: yang gzhan yang / mya ngan 'das pa'i dus na chad //
translated: Moreover,

original: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
analyzed: srid rgyun rab tu zhi phyir ro //
translated: If the continuum of existence were to cease at the time of nirvana,🔽Then nirvana would be a non-existent.

original: gal te srid pa'i rgyun yod par 'dod na de lta na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te srid pa'i rgyun yod par 'dod na de lta na mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the continuum of existence exists, then it follows that the view of annihilation would occur at the time of nirvana.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa'i rgyun rab tu zhi pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at the time of nirvana, the continuum of existence of an arhat is completely extinguished.

original: de lta bas na srid pa'i rgyun yod par rtog na yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na srid pa'i rgyun yod par rtog na yang rtag pa dang chad par lta bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, even if you imagine that the continuum of existence exists, it follows that the views of permanence and annihilation would occur.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang bla ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i dus na chad par gyur na gyur kyang bla ste /
translated: “Even if it were to cease at the time of nirvana, so what?

original: srid pa'i rgyun nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pas chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun nyid mtshams sbyor ba yod pas chad par lta bar thal bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the continuum of existence itself is connected, it is not the case that the view of annihilation would occur.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
analyzed: tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni //
translated: The last moment would cease,

original: srid pa dang po sbyor mi 'gyur //🔽tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
analyzed: srid pa dang po sbyor mi 'gyur // tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa //
translated: The first existence would not be connected to the second.🔽The first existence would not be connected to the second if the last moment of the existence at death did not cease.

original: srid pa dang po sbyor mi 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dang po sbyor mi 'gyur //
translated: The first existence would not be connected to the second if the last moment of the existence at death did not cease.

original: 'di la srid pa tha ma ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems can tha ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di la srid pa tha ma ni 'chi ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems can tha ma yin la /
translated: Here, the last moment of the existence is the last moment of the existence at death.

original: srid pa dang po ni skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems dang po yin no //
analyzed: srid pa dang po ni skye ba'i char gtogs pa'i sems dang po yin no //
translated: The first existence is the first moment of the existence at birth.

original: de la gal te srid pa'i rgyun nyid mtshams sbyor ba zhig yod na /🔽srid pa tha ma 'gags pa'am /
analyzed: de la gal te srid pa'i rgyun nyid mtshams sbyor ba zhig yod na / srid pa tha ma 'gags pa'am /
translated: If the stream of existence were to be connected,

original: ma 'gags ba zhig srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: ma 'gags ba zhig srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: would the first existence be connected to the second if the last moment of the existence at death has ceased or not ceased?

original: de la re zhig srid pa tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi @81a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig srid pa tha ma 'gags par gyur pa ni srid pa dang po dang nyid mtshams sbyor bar mi @81a * //
translated: The first existence would not be connected to the second if the last moment of the existence at death has ceased.🔽Why is that?

original: 'gyur te / ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram /🔽srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no //
analyzed: 'gyur te / ci'i phyir zhe na / 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ram / srid pa tha ma yin pa'i phyir dper na dgra bcom pa'i srid pa tha ma 'gags pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it has ceased,🔽like the last moment of the existence of an arhat.

original: srid pa tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa /
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gags par ma gyur pa /
translated: The first existence would not be connected to the second if the last moment of the existence at death has not ceased.

original: yang srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Also, the first birth would not link with the intermediate existence.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te dper na da ltar gyi srid pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ma 'gags pa nyid yin pa'i phyir te dper na da ltar gyi srid pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it would not have ceased, like the present existence.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med kyang /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / srid pa tha ma 'gags pa dang ma 'gags pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor ba med kyang /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po nying mtshams sbyor ro //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po nying mtshams sbyor ro //
translated: “Although the final existence that has ceased or not ceased does not link with the first existence, the final existence that is ceasing links with the first existence.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here, we say:

original: gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
analyzed: gal te tha ma 'gag bzhin pa //
translated: If the final existence that is ceasing

original: dang por skye bar gyur na ni //
analyzed: dang por skye bar gyur na ni //
translated: Linked with the first existence that is arising,

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig 'gyur zhing //
translated: Then that which is ceasing would be one

original: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur //
translated: And that which is arising would be another.

original: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa srid pa dang po dang nying mtshams sbyor bar gyur na /
translated: If the final existence that is ceasing linked with the first existence,

original: de lta na srid pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na srid pa gnyis su thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then in that case two existences would ensue.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig tu 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: 'gag bzhin pa ni gcig tu 'gyur zhing /
translated: That which is ceasing would be one.

original: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: skye bzhin pa yang gzhan du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because that now arising would be different.

original: rgyu tha dad pa'i srid pa bzhin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa'i srid pa bzhin pas de ni mi 'dod do //
translated: But that is unacceptable, because it would be a different cause, like an existence.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: 'di la 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig na yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig na yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, that which is now ceasing and that which is now arising do not exist at the same time.

original: 'di ltar srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na srid pa dang po skye'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na srid pa dang po skye'o //
translated: Thus, when the final existence is now ceasing, the first existence arises.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:🔽If that which is now ceasing🔽and that which is now arising

original: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin skye bzhin dag / lhan cig sbyor ba'ang yod min na //
translated: do not occur together,

original: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: phung po gang la 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: then death would occur in one body

original: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: der ni skye ba'ang 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: and birth in another.

original: gal te 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig na yod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig na yod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If that which is now ceasing and that which is now arising do not exist at the same time,

original: 'di ltar srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na /
translated: then when the final existence is now ceasing,

original: srid pa dang po skye ba yin na /
analyzed: srid pa dang po skye ba yin na /
translated: the first existence arises.

original: 'o na da de lta na phung po gang dag la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag nyid la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na da de lta na phung po gang dag la 'chi bar 'gyur ba de dag nyid la skye ba yang 'byung bar thal bar gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then it follows that birth would occur in the very aggregates in which death occurs.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phung po gang dag 'gag bzhin pa de dag nyid la skye bzhin pa yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po gang dag 'gag bzhin pa de dag nyid la skye bzhin pa yod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you assert that birth occurs in the very aggregates that are ceasing.

original: de lta na 'chi ba dang skye ba mi mthun pa gnyis phung po gcig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: de lta na 'chi ba dang skye ba mi mthun pa gnyis phung po gcig la dus gcig tu 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If that were so, then two incompatible states—death and birth—would occur simultaneously in a single person.

original: de ni mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de ni mi 'dod de /
translated: But that is unacceptable.

original: de'i phyir 'di la 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig na yod pa @81b ma yin gyi /🔽'di ltar srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la 'gag bzhin pa dang skye bzhin pa zhes bya ba de gnyis dus gcig na yod pa @81b ma yin gyi / 'di ltar srid pa tha ma 'gag bzhin pa na /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that both that which is ceasing and that which is arising exist at the same time.

original: srid pa dang po skye'o zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //🔽de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //
analyzed: srid pa dang po skye'o zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no // de ltar dus gsum dag tu yang //
translated: Thus, it is illogical to say that when the final moment of existence is ceasing, the first moment of existence arises.

original: srid pa'i rgyun ni mi rigs te //🔽dus gsum dag tu gang med pa /
analyzed: srid pa'i rgyun ni mi rigs te // dus gsum dag tu gang med pa /
translated: Thus, the continuum of existence is illogical in the three times.

original: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun //
translated: How could that which does not exist in the three times🔽Be a continuum of existence?

original: de ltar yongs su brtags na dus gsum dag tu yang srid pa'i rgyun mi rigs na /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su brtags na dus gsum dag tu yang srid pa'i rgyun mi rigs na /
translated: If the continuum of existence is thus investigated in the three times, it is illogical.

original: dus gsum dag tu rnam pa thams cad du brtags na /
analyzed: dus gsum dag tu rnam pa thams cad du brtags na /
translated: If the continuum of existence is investigated in all ways in the three times,

original: gang med pa de ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun yin te sa bon tshig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang med pa de ji ltar srid pa'i rgyun yin te sa bon tshig pa bzhin no //
translated: how could that which does not exist be the continuum of existence? It is like a burnt seed.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa brtag pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This is the chapter on origination and destruction.

original: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'o /🔽// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: rab tu byed pa nyi shu gcig pa'o / // / bam po drug pa /
translated: This is the twenty-first chapter.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dngos po rnams ni ngo bo nyid yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi gtso bo 'jig rten thams cad snang bar mdzad pa ston pa bstan pa rab tu gnas par mdzad pa yod ba bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas 'jig rten gyi gtso bo 'jig rten thams cad snang bar mdzad pa ston pa bstan pa rab tu gnas par mdzad pa yod ba bzhin no //
translated: Things definitely exist essentially because the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfect and Complete Buddha, the foremost being in the world, the illuminator of all things, the teacher, the maker of the well-proclaimed doctrine, exists.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
analyzed: sku min sku las gzhan ma yin //
translated: He is not the body, nor is he other than the body,

original: de la sku med der de med //
analyzed: de la sku med der de med //
translated: The body is not in him, nor is he in the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sku ldan min //
translated: The Tathāgata does not possess the body.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig yin //
translated: What is the Tathāgata?

original: 'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
analyzed: 'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba 'ga' zhig yod par gyur na /
translated: If the so-called Tathāgata exists,

original: de phung po rnams nyid dam /
analyzed: de phung po rnams nyid dam /
translated: is he the aggregates themselves,

original: phung po rnams las gzhan nam /🔽de la phung po rnams yod pa'am /🔽phung po rnams la de yod pa'am /
analyzed: phung po rnams las gzhan nam / de la phung po rnams yod pa'am / phung po rnams la de yod pa'am /
translated: or is he other than the aggregates,🔽or do the aggregates exist in him,🔽or does he exist in the aggregates,

original: de'i phung po rnams dang ldan pa zhig yin grang na /
analyzed: de'i phung po rnams dang ldan pa zhig yin grang na /
translated: or is he endowed with the aggregates?

original: de la re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams nyid ma yin te /
translated: First, the Tathāgata is not the aggregates themselves,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams yin par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams yin par gyur na /
translated: because if the Tathāgata were the aggregates,

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can yin pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid dang / nye bar len pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
translated: it would follow, absurdly, that he would be impermanent and that he would possess appropriation because he would be subject to origination and destruction.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore the Tathāgata is not the aggregates themselves.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata is also not other than the aggregates,🔽because

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yin na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gzung du yod par 'gyur bar rigs na /🔽de @82a * //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams las gzhan yin par gyur na 'byung ba dang 'jig pa'i chos can ma yin pa'i phyir rtog pa la sogs pa'i skyon du thal bar 'gyur ba dang / gzhan yin na mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams kyi gzung du yod par 'gyur bar rigs na / de @82a * //
translated: If he were different, it would be logical that he would be apprehended by the sense faculties such as the eyes,

original: lta ma yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: lta ma yin pas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: but since that is not the case, the Tathāgata is not different from the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata does not exist in the aggregates,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams yod par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams yod par gyur na /
translated: because if the Tathāgata existed in the aggregates,

original: ji ltar gangs la sman dang 'o ma la sbrang bu yod pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar gangs la sman dang 'o ma la sbrang bu yod pa bzhin du /
translated: just as medicine exists in snow or bees exist in honey,

original: de la phung po rnams gzhan nyid du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan nyid yin na skyon sngar bstan pa dag tu 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams gzhan nyid du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan nyid yin na skyon sngar bstan pa dag tu 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
translated: the aggregates would be clearly apprehended as different from him, and if they were different, the errors previously explained would ensue.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la phung po rnams yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates do not exist in the Tathāgata.

original: phung po rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phung po rnams la yang de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor does the Tathāgata exist in the aggregates,

original: gal te phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par gyur na /🔽ji ltar 'dug nas gzhan na /
analyzed: gal te phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa yod par gyur na / ji ltar 'dug nas gzhan na /
translated: because if the Tathāgata existed in the aggregates,🔽then he would be perceived as existing in the aggregates,

original: bram ze dang khye'u la ltad mo pa dang / phru rtog na 'o ma yod pa bzhin du /🔽phung po rnams la de gzhan nyid du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan nyid yin na skyon sngar bstan pa dag tu 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: bram ze dang khye'u la ltad mo pa dang / phru rtog na 'o ma yod pa bzhin du / phung po rnams la de gzhan nyid du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan nyid yin na skyon sngar bstan pa dag tu 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
translated: just as a cow exists in a pen or a child exists in a womb, or just as milk exists in cream.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But since the Tathāgata is not perceived as existing in the aggregates, he does not exist in the aggregates.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the Tathāgata endowed with the aggregates,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan par gyur na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan par gyur na /
translated: because if the Tathāgata were endowed with the aggregates,🔽then he would be perceived as existing in the aggregates,

original: ji ltar ba lang dang ldan pa dang nor dang ldan pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar ba lang dang ldan pa dang nor dang ldan pa bzhin du /
translated: just as a person is endowed with cattle or wealth.

original: de la phung po rnams gzhan nyid du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan nyid yin na skyon sngar bstan pa dag tu 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phung po rnams gzhan nyid du gsal bar dmigs par 'gyur ba dang / gzhan nyid yin na skyon sngar bstan pa dag tu 'gyur bas de lta ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the aggregates would be clearly seen to be different, and if they were different, the previously explained errors would ensue.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is not the same as the aggregates.

original: de ltar rnam pa lngas btsal nas yod pa ma yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa lngas btsal nas yod pa ma yin pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de gang zhig yin te /
translated: Thus, when the Tathāgata is sought in the fivefold way, he does not exist.

original: de'i phyir dngos po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po rnams yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Therefore, things do exist,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod bzhin no zhes gang smras pa de rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: and it is not reasonable to say, “The Tathāgata exists.”

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa de dag gis btsal na med du zin kyang phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par yod do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa brtag pa de dag gis btsal na med du zin kyang phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par yod do //
translated: Even though the Tathāgata is not found when sought through these analyses, he is imputed as existing in dependence on the aggregates.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas phung po la //
translated: If the Buddha does not exist

original: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med //
analyzed: brten nas ngo bo nyid las med //
translated: In virtue of his own nature in dependence on the aggregates,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po la brten nas gdags @82b par 'dod na 'o na da de lta na ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po la brten nas gdags @82b par 'dod na 'o na da de lta na ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If you assert that the Tathāgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates, then in that case he does not exist due to his own intrinsic reality.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin yang gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //🔽'dir bshad pa /🔽ngo bo nyid las gang med pa //🔽de gzhan dngos las ga la yod //
analyzed: de ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin yang gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do // 'dir bshad pa / ngo bo nyid las gang med pa // de gzhan dngos las ga la yod //
translated: If he does not exist due to his own intrinsic reality,🔽How could he exist due to the reality of another?

original: gal te ngo bo nyid las gang med pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par gal 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid las gang med pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par gal 'gyur te /
translated: If he does not exist due to his own intrinsic reality, how could he exist due to the reality of another?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gzhan gyi dngos po de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'thad bas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las med pa gang yin pa de ci'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po de la yang ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir dang / gnyen po med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po mi 'thad bas de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid las med pa gang yin pa de ci'i phyir gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par 'gyur /
translated: Because the reality of another is not tenable since it lacks intrinsic reality and lacks an antidote. Therefore, how could the Tathāgata who does not exist due to his own intrinsic reality exist due to the reality of another?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: de ni nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur pa la brten nas gdags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur pa la brten nas gdags pa yin no //
translated: It is imputed in dependence on the transformation of appropriation.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos brten nas //
translated: Here we say:🔽It is not tenable that

original: de bdag nyid du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bdag nyid du mi 'thad do //
translated: that which is dependent on another is itself.

original: gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas gdags par bya ba de ni /
translated: That which is to be imputed in dependence on another

original: bdag nyid yod do zhes brjod par mi 'thad de /
analyzed: bdag nyid yod do zhes brjod par mi 'thad de /
translated: is not tenable to say it exists by itself.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it not tenable?

original: rang las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang las ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not established from itself.

original: gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
analyzed: gang zhig bdag nyid med pa de //
translated: That which does not exist by itself

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur //
translated: how could it be a tathāgata?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig rang gi bdag nyid med pa de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gang zhig rang gi bdag nyid med pa de /
translated: That which is a tathāgata does not exist by itself.

original: de nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur pa la brten nas gdags par bya bas ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de nye bar len pa gzhan du gyur pa la brten nas gdags par bya bas ji ltar de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur /
translated: Since it is to be imputed in dependence on the transformation of appropriation, how could it be a tathāgata?

original: yang gzhan yang /
analyzed: yang gzhan yang /
translated: Moreover:

original: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid med na //
translated: If it lacks intrinsic reality,

original: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: gzhan dngos yod par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: how could an extrinsic reality exist?

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ngo bo nyid med na /
translated: If the Tathāgata lacks intrinsic reality,

original: de la gzhan gyi dngos po yod par ji ltar gyur te /
analyzed: de la gzhan gyi dngos po yod par ji ltar gyur te /
translated: How could the Tathāgata exist in the nature of something other?

original: de med na de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas 'grub par 'gyur ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na de bzhin gshegs pa gzhan gyi dngos po la brten nas 'grub par 'gyur ba yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If he does not exist, then the Tathāgata is not established in dependence on something other.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Objection:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin kyang yod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa 'grub bo //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid nges par ma zin kyang yod pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa 'grub bo //
translated: Even though the essence of the Tathāgata is not ascertained, he exists, and therefore the Tathāgata is established.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan dngos dag /
translated: Apart from essence and the nature of something other,

original: ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //
analyzed: ma gtogs de bzhin gshegs de gang //
translated: what Tathāgata is there?

original: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs pa de gang yin pa dang / gang gis gdags par bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dag ma gtogs par de bzhin gshegs pa de gang yin pa dang / gang gis gdags par bya ba gzhan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Apart from essence and the nature of something other, there is no other Tathāgata who is designated and by whom he is designated.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags @83a * //🔽par bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni phung po rnams la brten nas gdags @83a * // par bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: “The Tathāgata is designated in dependence on the aggregates.

original: de ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
analyzed: de ni de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pas /
translated: He is not described as being either the same as or different from them.

original: phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po rnams kyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin la gzhan gyi ngo bo nyid kyang ma yin no //
translated: The Tathāgata is not the intrinsic reality of the aggregates, nor is he the intrinsic reality of something else.

original: 'dir bshad pa /🔽gal te phung po ma brten par //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa / gal te phung po ma brten par //
translated: Here we say:🔽If the Tathāgata exists

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yod na //
translated: Without depending on the aggregates,

original: de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
analyzed: de ni da gdod brten 'gyur zhing //
translated: Then he would be dependent later,🔽And his dependence would be causeless.

original: brten nas de la 'gyur la rag /'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin na /🔽de de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
analyzed: brten nas de la 'gyur la rag /'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin na / de de bzhin gshegs pa'am /
translated: If the Tathāgata is imputed in dependence on the aggregates,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa zhig de bzhin gshegs pa'i phung po rnams la brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin grang na /
translated: is he the Tathāgata or not the Tathāgata that is imputed in dependence on the Tathāgata’s aggregates?

original: de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni /
analyzed: de la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa yin na ni /
translated: If he is the Tathāgata,

original: de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de de la brten pa don med pa nyid do //
translated: then it is meaningless for him to depend on them.

original: 'o na gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na ni de lta na yang gal te phung po rnams la ma brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid gzhan gyi gnas pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni de dag dod phung po rnams la brten🔽par 'gyur zhing brten nas de las de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur la rag go /'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin na ni de lta na yang gal te phung po rnams la ma brten pa'i snga rol na de bzhin gshegs pa bdag nyid gzhan gyi gnas pa 'ga' zhig yod na ni de dag dod phung po rnams la brten par 'gyur zhing brten nas de las de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur la rag go /'dir smras pa /
translated: But if the Tathāgata does not exist, then in that case, if the Tathāgata existed prior to the aggregates, without depending on the aggregates, then he would depend on the aggregates later.🔽And depending on them, he would become a Tathāgata.

original: de ltar 'gyur ro //🔽'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: de ltar 'gyur ro // 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Objection: That is so!

original: phung po rnams la ma brten par //
analyzed: phung po rnams la ma brten par //
translated: In response, Nāgārjuna explains:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang med //
translated: The Tathāgata does not exist

original: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
analyzed: gang zhig ma brten yod min pa //
translated: Without depending on the aggregates.

original: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
analyzed: des ni ji ltar nyer len 'gyur //
translated: How could he appropriate🔽That which does not exist without depending on the aggregates?

original: phung po rnams la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phung po rnams la ma brten par de bzhin gshegs pa 'ga' yang mi 'thad do //
translated: The Tathāgata is not tenable without depending on the aggregates.

original: gang phung po rnams la ma brten par yod pa ma yin pa des ji ltar phung po rnams nye bar len par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang phung po rnams la ma brten par yod pa ma yin pa des ji ltar phung po rnams nye bar len par 'gyur te /
translated: How could he appropriate the aggregates?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: He would not be the Tathāgata.

original: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na de las gzhan bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like something other than that.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone says:

original: 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag la snga phyi med pas de dag brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin gshegs pa la yang de nyid dang gzhan nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir nye bar len pa po dang nye bar blang ba dag la snga phyi med pas de dag brten nas gdags par bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: Because cyclic existence has no beginning or end, and because the Tathāgata is not described as being the same or different, the appropriator and that appropriated do not exist sequentially. Therefore they are to be imputed in dependence.

original: 'dir bshad pa ;🔽nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa ; nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa //
translated: Here we say:🔽How could that which is not appropriated

original: nye bar len par cis mi 'gyur //🔽nye bar len pa med pa yi //
analyzed: nye bar len par cis mi 'gyur // nye bar len pa med pa yi //
translated: Become the appropriator?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ci yang med //
translated: The Tathāgata does not exist🔽Without appropriation.

original: gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med par nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag la snga phyi yod par mi 'thad na /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni @83b nye bar len pa po yin la /
analyzed: gal te 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med par nye bar len pa po dang / nye bar blang ba dag la snga phyi yod par mi 'thad na / de bzhin gshegs pa ni @83b nye bar len pa po yin la /
translated: If it is untenable that the appropriator and that appropriated exist sequentially in cyclic existence, which has no beginning or end,🔽then it is also untenable to say that the Tathāgata is the appropriator

original: phung po rnams ni nye bar blangs pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad de /
analyzed: phung po rnams ni nye bar blangs pa yin no zhes bya ba de yang mi 'thad de /
translated: and the aggregates are that appropriated.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽'di la nye bar blang ba yin pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / 'di la nye bar blang ba yin pas /
translated: Why is this?🔽Because it is that which is appropriated.

original: nye bar len pa zhes bya la nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya ba yin na /🔽'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pas 'di ni nye bar blang ba'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes bya la nye bar len par byed pas nye bar len pa po zhes bya ba yin na / 'khor ba la thog ma dang tha ma med pas 'di ni nye bar blang ba'o //
translated: It is called appropriation because it appropriates.

original: 'di ni nye bar len par byed pa'o zhes bya ba de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar len par byed pa'o zhes bya ba de dag mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: But since samsara has no beginning or end, it is untenable to say, “This is that which is appropriated,” and “This is the appropriator.”

original: nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa yang nye bar len par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: nye bar len pa pos nye bar blangs pa ma yin pa yang nye bar len par mi 'gyur la /
translated: That which is not appropriated by the appropriator would not become appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa med pa yang nye bar len pa po de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa med pa yang nye bar len pa po de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And that which lacks appropriation would not become the so-called “tathāgata, the appropriator.”

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here, someone might say,

original: nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Tathāgata exists because he is imputed in dependence on appropriation.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we reply:

original: rnam pa lngas ni btsal byas na //🔽gang zhig de nyid gzhan nyid du //
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni btsal byas na // gang zhig de nyid gzhan nyid du //
translated: When you search in five ways,🔽The Tathāgata who does not exist

original: med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de //
analyzed: med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de //
translated: As the same or different

original: nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags //
analyzed: nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags //
translated: How could the Tathāgata be imputed by appropriation?

original: 'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba zhig yod par gyur na /🔽de nye bar len pa las de nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la gal te de bzhin gshegs pa nye bar len pas gdags par bya ba zhig yod par gyur na / de nye bar len pa las de nyid dam /
translated: If the Tathāgata were imputed by appropriation,

original: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: gzhan nyid du 'gyur grang na /
translated: he would be identical to or different from appropriation.

original: rnam pa lngas btsal na gang zhig de nyid dang gzhan nyid du med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas btsal na gang zhig de nyid dang gzhan nyid du med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa de nye bar len pas ji ltar gdags par bya ste /
translated: But when sought in the fivefold way, the Tathāgata who is neither identical to nor different from appropriation is not found. How could he be imputed by appropriation?

original: de'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore this is not reasonable.

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽nye bar len pa po ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / nye bar len pa po ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: nye bar blang ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “The appropriator surely exists because appropriation exists.”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang zhig nye bar blang ba de //
analyzed: gang zhig nye bar blang ba de //
translated: That which is appropriation

original: de ni ngo bo nyid las med //
analyzed: de ni ngo bo nyid las med //
translated: does not exist intrinsically.

original: nye bar blang ba gnag yod do snyam du sems pa de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba gnag yod do snyam du sems pa de yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i phyir ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin no //
translated: That which is thought to be appropriation does not exist intrinsically because it arises dependently.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: nye bar blang ba de ni ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin yang gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba de ni ngo bo nyid las yod pa ma yin yang gzhan gyi dngos po las yod do //
translated: That appropriated does not exist by way of its own entity, but it does exist by way of the entity of another.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: bdag gi dngos las gang med pa //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos las gang med pa //
translated: How could that which does not exist by way of its own entity

original: de gzhan dngos las yod re skan //
analyzed: de gzhan dngos las yod re skan //
translated: Exist by way of the entity of another?

original: nye bar len pa gang bdag gi dngos po las med pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par 'gyur re skan te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa gang bdag gi dngos po las med pa de gzhan gyi dngos po las yod par 'gyur re skan te /
translated: How could that appropriated, which does not exist by way of its own entity, exist by way of the entity of another?

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /🔽bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / bdag gi dngos po yod pa ma yin pas /
translated: Why is it so?🔽Because since its own entity does not exist,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: the entity of another also does not exist.

original: yang bshad pa /
analyzed: yang bshad pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: bdag ces bya ba brten nas ni //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba brten nas ni //
translated: The so-called self does not exist

original: rnam lnga'i snga rol nyer len med //🔽ma brten nye bar len pa @84a * //
analyzed: rnam lnga'i snga rol nyer len med // ma brten nye bar len pa @84a * //
translated: Prior to the five prior to appropriation.🔽Without a basis, how could there be

original: ni // 'ga' yang ji ltar yod mi 'gyur //
analyzed: ni // 'ga' yang ji ltar yod mi 'gyur //
translated: Any appropriation at all?

original: nye bar blang ba de yang ni //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba de yang ni //
translated: Moreover, that appropriated

original: nyer len de yi snga rol na //
analyzed: nyer len de yi snga rol na //
translated: Does not exist prior to appropriation.

original: nye bar blang ba yod min na //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba yod min na //
translated: If the appropriated does not exist,

original: nyer len ji ltar yod par 'gyur //🔽nyer len nye bar blang de la //
analyzed: nyer len ji ltar yod par 'gyur //🔽nyer len nye bar blang de la //
translated: How could appropriation exist?

original: brten pa yod min ma brten med //
analyzed: brten pa yod min ma brten med //
translated: It does not exist in dependence on the appropriated.

original: nyer len nye bar blang las min //
analyzed: nyer len nye bar blang las min //
translated: It does not exist without appropriation.

original: nyer blang min las yod ma yin //🔽nyer blang nye bar len pa'i min //
analyzed: nyer blang min las yod ma yin // nyer blang nye bar len pa'i min //
translated: It does not exist without the appropriated.🔽The appropriated does not exist in the appropriator.

original: nyer len min pa'i ma yin te //🔽de ni nyer len brten pa min //🔽nyer len min la brten ma yin //
analyzed: nyer len min pa'i ma yin te // de ni nyer len brten pa min // nyer len min la brten ma yin //
translated: The appropriator does not exist in the appropriated.🔽The appropriator does not exist in dependence on the appropriated.

original: nyer len 'grub pa gang yin pa //
analyzed: nyer len 'grub pa gang yin pa //
translated: The appropriator does not exist without appropriation.

original: nye bar blang las 'gyur yin na //
analyzed: nye bar blang las 'gyur yin na //
translated: If the appropriator is established🔽In dependence on the appropriated,

original: de grub med na nyer len pa'i //
analyzed: de grub med na nyer len pa'i //
translated: If the appropriated is not established,

original: 'grub pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'grub pa ji ltar yod par 'gyur //
translated: How could the appropriator be established?

original: gal te nyer len 'grub 'gyur ba'i //🔽nye bar blang ba ma grub na //
analyzed: gal te nyer len 'grub 'gyur ba'i // nye bar blang ba ma grub na //
translated: If the appropriated🔽Is not established,

original: nyer len grub pa yod min pas //
analyzed: nyer len grub pa yod min pas //
translated: Since the appropriated is not established,

original: nye bar blang ba'i byed pa med //
analyzed: nye bar blang ba'i byed pa med //
translated: The appropriator has no activity.

original: de ltar nyer blang nyer len po //
analyzed: de ltar nyer blang nyer len po //
translated: Thus the appropriated and the appropriator

original: rnam pa kun gyis stong pa yin //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyis stong pa yin //
translated: Are empty in every respect.

original: stong bas de bzhin gshegs stong pa //
analyzed: stong bas de bzhin gshegs stong pa //
translated: Since the appropriated is empty,

original: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur //
analyzed: ji lta bur na 'dogs par 'gyur //
translated: How could the Tathāgata be imputed?

original: de ltar gang gi phyir nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po dag ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa rnam pa kun gyis stong pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gang gi phyir nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po dag ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs pa rnam pa kun gyis stong pa de'i phyir /
translated: As such, because the appropriated and the appropriator are empty in every way of intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, sameness, difference, and so on,

original: don dam pa'i de kho na mthong ba dag nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po rtogs pa de lta bu des /
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na mthong ba dag nye bar blang ba dang nye bar len pa po rtogs pa de lta bu des /
translated: those who see the ultimate reality of things,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yod do zhes 'dogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: do not impute the existence of the Tathāgata.

original: de lta bas na brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na brten nas gdags par bya ba'i don ni rnam pa thams cad du stong pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang de nyid dang gzhan nyid la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, because the meaning of dependent imputation is completely empty, it cannot be described as intrinsic reality, extrinsic reality, sameness, difference, and so on.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here you may say:

original: ji 'o na da stong ngo zhes bya ba de nges pa yin nam /
analyzed: ji 'o na da stong ngo zhes bya ba de nges pa yin nam /
translated: Well then, is it certain that it is empty?

original: 'dir smras pa /🔽stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / stong ngo zhes kyang mi brjod de //
translated: Here you may say:🔽Do not say it is empty,

original: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
analyzed: mi stong zhes kyang mi bya zhing //
translated: Do not say it is not empty,

original: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
analyzed: gnyis dang gnyis min mi bya ste //
translated: One should not say that it is both or that it is neither.

original: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya //🔽stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
analyzed: gdags pa'i don du brjod par bya // stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /
translated: It is said for the sake of designation.🔽One should not say that it is empty,

original: mi stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya /🔽stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes kyang brjod bar mi bya /
analyzed: mi stong ngo zhes kyang brjod par mi bya / stong pa dang mi stong pa zhes kyang brjod bar mi bya /
translated: nor that it is not empty,🔽nor that it is both empty and not empty,

original: stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: stong pa yang ma yin mi stong pa yang ma yin zhes kyang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: nor that it is neither empty nor not empty.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs tsam gsal ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs tsam gsal ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the mere counteragent is engaged for the sake of clarity.

original: yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir dang don dam pa'i don kho na gdags @84b pa'i don du ni de dag brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin par rtog pa'i dri ma bkru ba'i phyir dang don dam pa'i don kho na gdags @84b pa'i don du ni de dag brjod par bya'o //
translated: However, they should be said for the sake of washing away the stain of false imagination and for the sake of designating the meaning of the ultimate.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here someone might say,

original: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid dang gzhan gyi dngos po las kyang yod pa ma yin na /
translated: “If the Tathāgata does not exist in terms of his own intrinsic reality or in terms of the reality of another,

original: ci'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin zhen /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa dang mtha' dang mtha' med pa la sogs par brjod par bya ba ma yin zhen /
translated: why is he not to be described as permanent or impermanent, and so on, as having an end or not having an end, and so on?”

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: rtag dang mi rtag la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as permanent and impermanent

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: exist in this peace?

original: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
analyzed: mtha' dang mtha' med la sogs bzhi //
translated: How could the four such as finite and infinite exist

original: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
analyzed: zhi ba 'di la ga la yod //
translated: in this peace?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po de dag dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis ma skyes pa zhi ba 'di la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dang rtag kyang rtag la mi rtag kyang mi rtag pa dang / rtag pa yang ma yin mi rtag pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba sngon gyi mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po de dag dang /
translated: How could the four views dependent on the prior limit such as the Tathāgata is permanent, the Tathāgata is impermanent, the Tathāgata is both permanent and impermanent, and the Tathāgata is neither permanent nor impermanent exist in this peace, since the Tathāgata is not essentially arisen?

original: mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa dang mtha' yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po de dag ga la yod de /
analyzed: mtha' yod pa dang mtha' med pa dang mtha' yod kyang yod la med kyang med pa dang / mtha' yod pa yang ma yin mtha' med pa yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba phyi ma'i mtha' la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po de dag ga la yod de /
translated: How could the four views dependent on the posterior limit such as the world is finite, the world is infinite, the world is both finite and infinite, and the world is neither finite nor infinite exist in this peace?

original: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam par de bzhin gshegs pa skye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately the Tathāgata is not arisen.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: The Tathāgata definitely exists.

original: mya ngan las 'das nas med do zhes lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das nas med do zhes lung du ma bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it was not declared that he does not exist after attaining nirvana.

original: 'dir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: gang gis 'dzin stug bzung gyur pa //🔽de ni mya ngan 'das pa la //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa yod ce'am //
analyzed: gang gis 'dzin stug bzung gyur pa // de ni mya ngan 'das pa la // de bzhin gshegs pa yod ce'am //
translated: One who is bound by the thick bonds🔽of “The Tathāgata exists after attaining nirvana”

original: med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed //
analyzed: med ces rnam rtog rtog par byed //
translated: or “The Tathāgata does not exist after attaining nirvana”🔽will conceptualize the Tathāgata.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs la goms pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i blo gros can gang gis 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa stug po bzung bar gyur pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnam pa sna tshogs la goms pa'i bag chags kyis bsgos pa'i blo gros can gang gis 'di nyid bden gyi gzhan ni don med pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa stug po bzung bar gyur pa de ni mya ngan las 'das pa la /
translated: One who is bound by the thick bonds of the thought “This alone is true, any other meaning is meaningless,” whose mind is stained by the latent propensities of various conceptual thoughts, will conceptualize the Tathāgata in the following ways:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod de zhe'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod de zhe'am /
translated: “The Tathāgata exists after attaining nirvana,”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med ce'am /
translated: “The Tathāgata does not exist after attaining nirvana,”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod kyang yod la /🔽med kyang med ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod kyang yod la /🔽med kyang med ce'am /
translated: “The Tathāgata exists and does not exist after attaining nirvana,”🔽“The Tathāgata neither exists nor does not exist after attaining nirvana.”

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po dag tu rnam par rtog pa la rtogs par byed do //🔽ngo bo nyid kyis stong de la //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa yang ma yin med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po dag tu rnam par rtog pa la rtogs par byed do // ngo bo nyid kyis stong de la //
translated: The Buddha said to Subhūti:🔽“Subhūti, you should know that

original: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mya ngan las 'das nas //
translated: after the Buddha’s nirvana,🔽it is not tenable to think

original: yod do zhe'am med do zhes //🔽bsam pa 'thad pa @85a * //🔽nyid mi 'gyur //
analyzed: yod do zhe'am med do zhes // bsam pa 'thad pa @85a * // nyid mi 'gyur //
translated: that he exists or does not exist.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mig bye bdag la ni mya ngan las 'das pa la de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod ce'am /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes kyi mig bye bdag la ni mya ngan las 'das pa la de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod ce'am /
translated: When the eye of right wisdom is opened, one does not think that the Tathāgata exists after attaining nirvana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med ce'am /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod kyang yod la med kyang med ce'am /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas med ce'am / de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod kyang yod la med kyang med ce'am /
translated: nor that he does not exist after attaining nirvana,🔽nor that he both exists and does not exist after attaining nirvana,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mya ngan las 'das nas yod pa yang ma yin /
translated: nor that he neither exists nor does not exist after attaining nirvana.

original: med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po de dag gi bsam pa 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: med pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa la brten pa'i lta ba bzhi po de dag gi bsam pa 'thad pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: The thought that nirvana is existent, nonexistent, both, or neither is not tenable,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo yul med pa la skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽gang dag sangs rgyas spros 'das shing //🔽zad pa med la spros byed pa //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo yul med pa la skye bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gang dag sangs rgyas spros 'das shing // zad pa med la spros byed pa //
translated: because a conceptual mind does not arise with respect to a nonexistent object.🔽Those who fabricate elaborations🔽with respect to the buddhas who are beyond elaboration

original: spros pas nyams pa de kun gyis //
analyzed: spros pas nyams pa de kun gyis //
translated: and who are inexhaustible

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mthong mi 'gyur //
translated: will not see the Tathāgata.
